The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation please click careers@mantech.com and provide your name and contact information.

title: Task Order Project Manager
description:
Task Order Project Manager  

Location: 100% Remote  

Clearance: Active Secret  

Certification Required: PMP  

  

Nationwide IT Services (NIS) is seeking a Task Order Project manager for a potential opportunity to serve as the project manager for a large, complex task order or a group of task orders affecting the same system.  

  

Requirements:
* To assist the Program Manager in working with the Government Contracting Officer (KO), the task order-level Task Order Managers, Government management personnel, and customer agency representatives.
* Under the guidance of the Program Manager, responsible for the overall management of the specific task order(s) and ensuring that the technical solutions and schedules in the task order are implemented promptly.
* Preferred experience in Microsoft Windows Operating Systems for on-premises and/or cloud-based systems.
* Sensitivity Level: IT-I – Critical Sensitive
* Clearance: Secret

**Education:**
* B.S., B.A., or 4 additional years of experience.

**Certifications:**
* Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification

**Experience:**
* 5 years of relevant experience
* 5 years of leadership experience with progressively higher responsibility in the public and/or private sector in the IT and/or consulting fields.


  

**About Nationwide IT Services**  

NIS is an IT and Management consulting company, is a CVE-verified Service-Disabled Veteran- Owned Small Business. Our mission is to deliver value-added services to our customers, leveraging technology, people, and industry best practices to implement innovative solutions through our trusted employees and team members.  

  

Our benefits package includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, life and disability insurance, 401(k) plan with employer match, paid holidays, PTO (sick/vacation), commuter benefits, employee assistance program (EAP), and educational reimbursement along with Pet Insurance.  

  

Nationwide IT Services, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Security Project Manager
description:
**Security Project Manager**

**Lead II - Software Engineering**

**Who we are:**

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.


UST is a mission-driven group of over 39,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.


With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.


Visit us at UST.com .  



**You Are:**

UST is looking for a highly energetic, flexible, and collaborative Security team lead with ample experience and knowledge in the areas of Application Security, Agile development/Support with solid technical background in Microservices and REST APIs to lead a team responsible to help end users effectively fix their application security issues related SAST/DAST/SCA scans.  



**The Opportunity** :


* Lead a team of security professionals, fostering a culture of security awareness and ensuring strict adherence to industry protocols.
* Direct end-to-end vulnerability management, from application scanning to efficient tracking and remediation of security vulnerabilities created out of various scans like SAST/DAST/SCA/Secrets detection within SLAs defined.
* Demonstrate a good understanding of Microservices and APIs.
* Collaborate seamlessly with development and domain teams, integrating security into the development process to shift security left and fostering knowledge sharing.
* Communicate technical security findings to non-technical stakeholders and executives, delivering actionable insights.
* Set up and facilitate team events, including Daily Stand-ups, Iteration Planning/Review/Retrospective.
* Ensure team productivity, velocity, and time management/integrity.
* Provide weekly status updates to leadership teams as well as prepare presentations to various stakeholders.
* Enable leadership to derive and communicate the business value from updates.
Coordinate requirements, schedules implementation, and post-implementation activities.  
* 

This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.  



**What you need:**

* Good knowledge in Sec DevOps methodologies
* Proven track record in helping people to fix OWASP top 10 issues.
* Good hands-on experience in any technologies like Java/.Net/node js
* Working knowledge in AWS/GCP/Mongo DB will be an added advantage.
Knowledge of Scrum frameworks and other Agile frameworks: Kanban, XP.  
* 

Compensation can differ depending on factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, education, and level of experience. As required by applicable law, UST provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in various U.S. markets as set forth below.


**Role Location: Remote**

**Compensation Range:** $84,000-$126,000


Our full-time, regular associates are eligible for 401K matching, and vacation accrual and are covered from day 1 for paid sick time, healthcare, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance benefits. Depending on the role, some associates may also be eligible for stock options.  



**What we believe** :


We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone, to champion diversity and inclusion, and to place people at the center of everything we do.


**Humility:**

We will listen, learn, be empathetic and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.


**Humanity:**

Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.


**Integrity:**

We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.  



**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**

  

UST is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


UST reserves the right to periodically redefine your roles and responsibilities based on the requirements of the organization and/or your performance.  



#CB


#LI-AP4

title: Senior IT Project Manager
description:
Overview:

In anticipation of award, Tantus Technologies, Inc. (Tantus) - recognized by the Washington Post as a Top Workplace - is seeking a Sr. IT Project Manager (PM) to be part of the PMO and apply broad management skills and function/technical expertise to guide project teams and deliver client solutions. You will analyze new and complex project-related issues and devise innovative solutions encompassing finance, scheduling, technology, methodology, tools, reporting, and solution components.
What You'll Do:
* Utilizing and developing PowerApps solutions to streamline project management processes, enhance collaboration, and support Agile practices within the organization.
* Managing the development of Sharepoint sites and tools
* Leading the development of an automated project status report that integrates with Jira/Confluence.
* Leading the development of an IT Portfolio Dashboard, that will be available to multiple levels of stakeholders.
* Leading projects and introducing new software solutions
* Implementing NHTSA DevSecOps and CI/CD procedures to integrate application environments and tools with Cloud Hosting, ensuring seamless integration and deployment into preproduction environments such as Development, Test and Stage environments.


Required Knowledge and Skills:
* Minimum 10 years of experience IT project management preferred, with a focus on IT Solutions methodologies and conducting assessments within complex IT environments.
* AWS or Azure experience
* Bachelor’s degree
* PMP Certification
* Agile Certification
* Federal government agency work experience.
* Strong knowledge of modernization and technology trends in the industry.
* Proficient in SharePoint
* Knowledge of Jira/Confluence
* Knowledge of DecSecOps and CI/CD procedures
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong understanding of how to use and develop solutions using PowerApps to optimize project management processes.


Abilities:
* Ability to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to Haves:
* Federal government agency work experience.

title: IT Project Engineer
description:
Purpose
  
The purpose of this role is to serve as a subject matter expert while completing ad-hoc projects in support of the IT Service Delivery team. This position will be responsible for recommending and/or creating tools that accelerate employee productivity, speed and accuracy primarily within the area of IT Service Delivery. Project assignments may be of a global scope.
  
  

Areas of Responsibility / Tasks
  
Performance must reflect appropriate level of expertise and achievement of the desired results for the items listed below.
  
  

1. IT Service Management Special Projects
  
a) Lead, organize and may solely perform various projects of a technical and complex nature
  
**b) Typical projects may include but not be limited to:** SML, Teams voice/reporting, Top Desk, etc.
  
c) Projects will vary based on the evolving needs of the organization and at the direction of the Director, Global Service Delivery/IT
  
  

2. Work with IT and other business project teams as needed
  
  

3. All other duties as assigned
  
  

Supervisory Responsibilities
  
1. Not Applicable
  
  

Competencies; Knowledge, Skills, Abilities (KSA)
  
To perform this role successfully, an individual must have experience achieving desired result(s) in their areas of responsibility. The requirements listed below are representative of observable behaviors and essential knowledge, skill, and abilities required of a successful incumbent within our culture.
  
1. Strong communication skills, keen listener, professional verbal, and written skills.
  
2. Ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues independently or by escalating as needed
  
3. Be proactive in training and seek out knowledge as needed to perform job responsibilities
  
4. Flexible. Able to cope with multiple/changing/competing priorities and deadlines with a high degree of optimism, professionalism, and collaboration.
  
  

Minimum Qualifications/ Education / Experience / Certifications
  
  

**1. Education:**  

a. Bachelor's degree or related training equivalent - preferred
  
b. Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in similar title and scope of responsibility - required
  
  

**2. Systems Experience:**  

a. Windows Operating System and MS Office is required (Mac OS is preferred)
  
b. Knowledge of IP Networking fundamentals required (IPv4, sub-netting, DNS, OSI Model, Network cabling)
  
c. Knowledge of mobile devices is required (iPhone, iPad, Android)
  
d. Working knowledge of Azure Active Directory (AAD) and other Microsoft Cloud Services required
  
e. Familiar with various Web Based Conferencing / Communications applications – required (Teams, Zoom)
  
f. Microsoft Office Suite, Teams and SharePoint
  
g. Camera/video security equipment preferred
  
  

**3. Licenses / Certifications:**  

a. Valid driver’s license – required
  
b. Related IT Certifications is plus
  
  

**4. Language:**  

a. Proficiency in English required
  
b. Bi-Lingual – Spanish or Portuguese is a plus
  
  

**5. Cultural Experience:**

b. Similar size organization – preferred

Ravago Americas is an equal employment opportunity employer. title: Project Manager (REMOTE)
description:
**EAM Project Manager**



As a Project Manager specializing in EAM implementations, you will have the opportunity to leverage your exceptional leadership and management abilities within our dynamic software implementation and technology services team. Your primary responsibility will be to spearhead crucial projects, orchestrating the seamless coordination and delivery of software applications, business processes, training, and documentation for our esteemed clients. Your role demands meticulous oversight, where you'll be tasked with managing scope, cost, and schedule to ensure the successful execution of contract deliverables, all while aligning with our overarching business and strategic goals.

 *Responsibilities and Duties:*


* Act as the primary liaison and consultant for multiple clients throughout the delivery phase of new EAM implementations and enhancement projects.
* Oversee project scope, budgets, and go-live milestones, proactively anticipating challenges and devising solutions to ensure seamless implementations.
* Identify and manage execution, client, and resource risks, developing and implementing mitigation and avoidance strategies.
* Maintain regular communication with clients and project teams to manage expectations and provide updates on project progress.
* Assume financial accountability, including planning, budgeting, reporting, and forecasting resource costs, ensuring project performance aligns with revenue recognition goals.
* Collaborate with delivery leaders to optimize resource allocation, matching skill sets to client requirements and ensuring teams are equipped to operate autonomously.
* Take ownership of resolving escalations, prioritizing positive client outcomes.
* Work closely with the Client Success team to foster client growth and retention while effectively managing project scope.
* Support the Sales and Client Success teams in crafting responses to Requests for Proposal and scoping new professional services engagements.
* Facilitate the creation of HxGN support incidents on behalf of clients and manage software enhancement requests.
* Participate in HxGN events, including webinars, user groups, technical education sessions, and onsite events.
* Maintain open communication with HxGN EAM sales representatives and other relevant stakeholders regarding project progress and issues.
* Perform additional duties as assigned.


*Team Participation:*


* Attend company retreats
* Contribute to internal projects
* Attend staff meetings via web meeting
* Contribute to Stratum knowledge base
* When not on active project assignment, participate in the customer service operation by completing service tickets.


*Travel:*


* This position requires frequent travel, approximately 50%, but is variable.


Supervision and Team Interactions:


* Reports to: VP of Customer Success and VP of Sales
* Gets assistance from: EAM Architect on projects and team members via Slack Assist channel, email, etc.
* Cooperates with: All departments and team members and HxGN sales representatives


Qualifications and Skills:


* Bachelor of Science or equivalent work experience in asset management, EAM technologies, or related professional services.
* 5+ years in EAM Implementations at varying size and scope
* Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.
* Solid financial acumen
* Solid understanding of Risk Management methodologies
* Situational Leadership skills preferred
* Superior ability to multi-task and meet changing deadlines.
* Ability and willingness to travel to client or internal company sites when appropriate and legally permitted.


*Salary and Benefits:*



Salary is based on experience. Benefits include 401k, long-term disability, parental leave, Unlimited PTO, and profit-sharing plans.


*Opportunities for Advancement:*



The EAM Project Manager may advance to the position of EAM Senior Project Manager.

 **ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**


* No visa sponsorship is available for this position. Must be a US citizen and live in the US to be considered for this role.

  


**Company Overview**



Stratum Consulting Partners, Inc., founded in 2003 and headquartered in Broomfield, CO, is a certified HxGN Alliance Partner and CloudSuite implementation firm that offers deep domain expertise in EAM implementations. Collectively, the Stratum team has over a century of experience working with the HxGN EAM product line. Over the years we have been able to accrue, collect, integrate, and document a comprehensive set of proven practices for the maintenance organization, including a model or framework formalizing such concepts as roles and responsibilities, data coding structures, and detailed business processes. We focus on engagements where we can deliver both integrated best practice and HxGN EAM technology solutions.

  

Our core principles include arriving prepared and delivering quality every day, engaging with integrity and humility, delivering with excellence, and utilizing our experience and expertise to provide creative solutions. We are a virtual company with 20 team members spread across the United States and Canada. We strive to find ways to strengthen communication and build relationships through our retreats, Slack platform, and meetings to share company news. We are a “family first” company and encourage a healthy work/life balance. Stratum is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Program Manager
description:
cFocus Software seeks a Program Manager to join our program supporting the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Office of the Inspector General. This is a fully remote position. This position requires an active Public Trust clearance and must meet 8570 requirements.  

  

**Qualifications:*** Masters degree or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of experience with IT Program Management
* 5+ years of experience with Agile methodologies and project management.
* ServiceNow Platform and/or Systems Integration experience preferred.
* Active Public Trust Clearance
* 8570 Compliant (Security+ CE)
* Active Project Management Professional (PMP)
* Active ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD)

  

**Duties:*** Serving as the Contractor’s main point of contact, and this individual is responsible for the overall performance of the contract.

* Planning the entire program across scope, schedule, resources, risk, quality, etc., and monitoring the on-going execution of these areas.
* Ensuring that contract requirements, deliverables and service levels are met.
* Keeping the CORs and technical designers updated on all aspects of the contract and making them aware of any contract issues in a timely manner.

* Coordinate and collaborate operational, systems integration activities with other contracts.

* Planning, scheduling, resource management and associated costs, transition planning, reporting, deliverables preparation and submissions, establishing and maintaining records, risk management and lessons learned data repositories, quality assurance and metrics, customer relationship management, liaison activities, metric management, and strategic business planning.

* Identify risks associated with the development of new software efforts, the analysis and classification of those risks as to severity and likelihood, and the identification of techniques to mitigate the risks.
* Provide assistance to the staff with regard to security information updates and requirements for the applications developed.
* Provide information, technical, and management briefings and presentations to the COR and to other staff as requested by the COR on all aspects of the work being performed.

title: Oracle Cloud Project Portfolio Management - Lead Consultant
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**


A Lead Consultant at Argano is a highly experienced professional in the consulting family responsible for managing mid-to-large-size client engagements and contributing to the growth and development of the consulting practice. They provide expert advice, guidance, and solutions related to technology to businesses and organizations. They are indirect mentors to other areas and grades. Their goal is to help clients optimize their technology infrastructure, processes, and strategies to achieve their business objectives more efficiently and effectively. Lead consultants work with security, data management, crisis management and should demonstrate exceptional knowledge of technology to deliver quality work that will drive customer satisfaction, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work well within a team.


The Project Portfolio Management functional consultant is expected to have expertise in implementing Oracle Cloud PPM applications. The successful candidate will have completed two or more end-to-end implementations of Oracle Cloud PPM. This position focuses on guiding and assisting clients through all phases of implementation in the area of Oracle Cloud PPM. An Oracle Cloud PPM consultant defines client business requirements, designs and configures the system solution for order management applications, and assists with system validation, go-live preparation and support.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Lead mid to large size and complex consulting projects simultaneously.
* Using in-depth knowledge of the Oracle Cloud Project Portfolio Management. This should include:
	+ Resource Management,
	+ Task Management
	+ Project Financials
	+ Project Contract Billing
	+ Time and Labor for Projects
	+ Grant Management
* Industry expert with PPM business process.
* Knowledge of industry best practices
* Ability to consult with clients to provide cost effective solutions to client business scenarios.
* Works collaboratively with project team and client employees to develop, test, and implement Oracle Clouds solutions.
* Refine customer requirements in detail, document and present to the client for approval.
* Identifies and applies creative and innovative approaches to resolving product implementation and integration obstacles and problems.
* Analyze current systems and data to identify new requirements, recognizing the need for systems enhancements or modifications if necessary.
* Develop unit test scripts and coordinate with the client to perform the User Acceptance Testing of the system enhancements or custom solutions.
* Work with Oracle to resolve service requests.
* Lead and direct the following phases of system life cycle:
* Gather business requirements through business process workshops,
* Analysis, design, configure and development solutions for Oracle Maintenance applications,
* Conference Room Pilots (CRP) and User Acceptance Testing,
* Go-Live preparation and cut-over support and post-production support.
* Develop and implement long-term client strategies.
* Act as the primary point of contact for clients. Effectively communicate with clients, team members, and stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Keep all parties informed about project progress, challenges, and changes.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their business objectives, challenges, and technology requirements. Conduct thorough assessments to identify areas where technology can drive improvements and efficiencies.
* Provide expert advice on technology solutions and tools that can enhance the client's operations. Help clients make informed decisions about adopting and implementing new technologies.
* Collaborate with third-party vendors and suppliers to source necessary hardware, software, or services. Negotiate contracts and agreements to secure the best terms for the client.
* Offer ongoing technical support to address any issues or concerns that arise after implementation.
* Continuously monitor the performance of implemented solutions to identify areas for improvement or optimization. Provide recommendations for updates, upgrades, or modifications as needed.


**MINIMUM AND/OR PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

EDUCATION:


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Engineering, etc.
* MBA, relevant master's degree or PhD.


EXPERIENCE:


* Minimum 5- 10+ years of experience as Oracle Functional consultant with 3+ years of experience in implementing or supporting Oracle Cloud PPM projects and upgrades.
* Certified Oracle Cloud Project Portfolio Management Consultant. Certification should be within the last two years.
* Strong consulting experience and business analytical skills to gather and document business requirements, leading fit-gap analysis, business process designs, managing conference room pilots (CRPs), perform functional configuration, and manage testing of procurement ERP solutions.
* Ability to lead a team, work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
* Ability to maintain a positive attitude under stressful circumstances.
* Senior enough to be able to independently handle client expectations.
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, presentation, and communication skills
* High commitment to exceed performance expectations.
* High degree of initiative, accuracy, efficiency, and attention to detail
* Professional approach when dealing with internal and external customers.
* Ability to lead complete software development lifecycle including analysis, design, configuration, programming and unit testing.
* Produce end-user and technical documentation and facilitate knowledge transfer.
* Proficient with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Willingness to travel as needed.
* Preferred consulting experience in a similar role in a professional services firm or industry experience at a strategic level is required.
* Previous experience working in IT companies.
* In-depth knowledge of the technologies and systems relevant.

  

  

SKILL REQUIREMENTS


* **Communication:** Proficient in English written and verbal communications. Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with clients, team members, and stakeholders.
* **Complex Project Management:** Senior Consultants are responsible for leading multiple complex projects, necessitating exceptional project management skills.
* **Thought Leadership**: Providing thought leadership and industry expertise is critical in projects.
* **Client Acquisition:** They should have strong business development skills to acquire new clients and expand existing relationships.
* **Mentorship and Coaching:** Indirectly developing and coaching junior and mid-level consultants is a significant responsibility.
* **Strategic Vision:** Senior Consultants should contribute to the firm's strategic vision and decision-making.
* **Executive Presence:** The ability to interact effectively with senior client executives is important.


The base compensation range for this position is $100,000 - $180,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave and Flexible Time Off.

title: Software Project Manager
description:
**Software Project Manager**
============================

Wärtsilä Energy Storage & Optimization (ES&O) is the leading global energy storage optimizer. Our mission is to deliver integrated energy solutions that build a resilient, intelligent, and flexible energy infrastructure - unlocking the way to an optimized renewable future. By integrating renewables, energy management technology, and storage with traditional energy resources, we reinvent clean energy production from the largest and most complex grids to the most remote and essential microgrids. We play a key role in Wärtsilä’s vision towards a 100% renewable energy future through flexibility, reliability, and integration and a more sustainable world for us all.

  


The primary function of this role is to accelerate the development of our software products by holistically organizing, tracking, and prioritizing team efforts. The role will be an integral part of the Software Engineering teams in a Research and Development roles, supporting new product development initiatives in the field of Energy Storage & Optimization.

  

The preferred location for this position is Herndon, Virginia. This position will be a hybrid work structure where the employee can work remotely or from the office, as needed and based on demands of specific tasks. Another location that will be considered for this position is Houston, Texas.

  


**Essential Responsibilities**  

* Meet regularly with stakeholders for backlog grooming and prioritization of upcoming efforts.

* Capture the vision of what we are building and then accelerate the realization of that vision by keeping the priorities organized.
* Manage the interdependence between new feature development and Software Engineering group’s software release schedules, ensuring successful execution of our product roadmap.
* Develop and maintain the roadmaps, tracking progress and reporting regularly.
* Work with technical experts to develop project scopes and objectives to ensure technical feasibility.
* Ensure resource availability and allocation.


* Perform risk management notifying stakeholders of expected results as soon as possible.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation.


* The candidate must be able to embrace the fast and dynamic environment of a growth stage company, comfortable with adjusting quickly to changing priorities.

  


**Qualifications/Requirements**  

* Demonstrated software project management experience and accomplishment with commercial software product companies.
* Embedded software experience is preferred
* Solid technical background in software development
* Agile methodology and proficient in issue tracking tools such as Atlassian tools.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and skills
* Excellent organizational and people skills

* Attention to detail in the context of managing multiple software projects simultaneously.
* Previous hands-on coding experience

  


 **Desired Characteristics**  

* Experienced working in STEM context.
* Prior experience with production systems running advanced statistical algorithms and machine learning.
* Strong leadership record with active participation in renewable energy associations, forums, clubs, or groups
  


Last application date: 18/03/2024

  


**Why you and us:**


You will be a part of a global organization with local presence and work in an exciting and dynamic working environment with highly motivated and skilled co-workers. We offer interesting and challenging work tasks, as well as personal and professional development in a great team. If you feel excited by being a part of this working environment and think your personal skills and qualities match the job requirements, we look forward to receiving your job application. At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job-relevant merits and abilities.

  


**Successful applicant must be authorized to work in the USA without sponsorship**. We look forward to hearing from you. Qualified candidates must apply online: https://www.wartsila.com/careers

  


Individuals hired for positions that require on-site customer interactions and/or in-person travel may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or other country-specific vaccinations, unless otherwise prohibited by law. Wärtsilä North America values our employees. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. Wärtsilä North America is an EOE/AA employer.

title: NetSuite Project Manager
description:
NetSuite Project Manager-REMOTE


Cumula 3 Group is seeking an experienced and skilled Project Manager, specifically with skills in ERP (Netsuite, SAP, Oracle Cloud, etc) to join our Delivery Team.


This Senior Project Manager will own and manage the delivery of ERP implementations assigned, under the guidance of Cumula 3's delivery methodology. They will be responsible for the delivery according to the agreed-upon scope, time and budget.

  

The Project Manager will be responsible for overseeing and ensuring the highest degree of communication and customer satisfaction. They will also work collaboratively to facilitate and communicate with the internal project team, consisting of Consultants and Development resources as required, to ensure an on-time delivery of project objectives.


Responsibilities:


* Articulate the project objectives and leading practices for ERP implementation/optimization at Cumula 3
* Manage and maintain the project schedule, budget and tasks - assignments and dates - to ensure an on-time delivery of project objectives
* Be an expert in Cumula 3's project methodologies
* Work with other members of the delivery team to identify and communicate any project risks; escalating internally and externally based on Cumula 3's processes
* Ability to determine priorities and correlations to customer success when executing duties such as time approvals and task oversight.
* Work with other PMs and services management to balance priorities within the project portfolio that utilizes shared resources
* Has broad understanding of solutions and industry best practices, to help Cumula 3 build out a PMO
* Track project costs and billing milestones in order to meet budget
* The role is positioned for a player/coach with potential for future leadership in the PMO

  

  

**Requirements:**


* 3+ years of NetSuite experience
* 10+ years of Project Management experience
* Understanding of the PMI framework
* PMP Certification preferred
* Proven leadership skills
* Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills
* Must be organized, detailed and accountable
* Travel estimated at 5% -10%
* Ability to respond appropriately to changing priorities, demands and events

  

  

Performance Bonus, Company - 100% Paid Dental and Vision for Employee/Family, Company Subsidized Medical for Employee/Family, 401K Matching, Open PTO, Ongoing Staff Development/Training, and Company Profit Sharing.


We serve our Leads, Prospects, and Customers via the Golden Rule and we do the right thing for/by them. By virtue of having a consistent culture and practice of this for 9+ years (and individual reputations of key leadership going back 18+ years in the NetSuite ecosystem), we are growing rapidly and have assembled an incredible team here and at NetSuite that helps us find, advise, close, and serve more future, happy, NetSuite customers.

title: Cybersecurity Acquisition Program Manager
description: Cybersecurity Acquisition Program Manager Skill 1 IT Acquisition Program Management Skill 2 Policy Development and Advocacy Skill 3 Stakeholder Engagement Description of Duties Summary: The Cybersecurity Acquisition Program Manager / Technical Writer within the State's Information Security Office is a multifaceted role combining expertise in information security, program management, acquisitions, policy development, and technical writing. The position involves spearheading acquisition programs, ensuring information technology compliance, drafting policies, and producing comprehensive documentation related to information security practices. Key Responsibilities: Acquisition Program Management: • Oversee hardware, software, and information system acquisition programs adhering to IT-related laws and policies. • Ensure information security requirements are integrated into acquisitions, procurements, and outsourcing efforts. • Develop contract language to enforce supply chain, system, network, and operational security. Policy Development and Advocacy: • Formulate and advocate for policies supporting organizational cyberspace initiatives. • Resolve conflicts in laws, regulations, and standards pertaining to cybersecurity. Technical Writing: • Create comprehensive, easily understandable documentation on information security topics for diverse audiences. • Collaborate with subject-matter experts to accurately capture specialized information. • Review, edit, and finalize content ensuring alignment with NIST standards and state policies. Stakeholder Engagement: • Communicate effectively with program managers, contractors, and stakeholders regarding business problems and corrective actions related to information security. Required Skill Set/Skill • Bachelor's degree in a technology or writing-intensive discipline. • Demonstrated experience in technical writing, editing, and presenting information security-related documents. • Proficiency in information security concepts, NIST Framework (especially NIST SP 800-53), and information systems design. • Strong written and oral communication skills. • Ability to analyze laws, rules, and regulations to articulate policy guidance effectively. • Familiarity with Industry Compliance Standards (SOC 2, IRS Pub 1075, CMS MARS-E 2.2, PCI, CJIS, etc.). • Aptitude for developing plans, policies, and procedures meeting regulatory compliance requirements.

title: Salesforce Project Manager
description:
Location: **Remote**
  

Job Code: **24-031**
  

# of Openings: **3**  


**Description**
===============

  


At Technatomy, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customer’s success. We provide solutions to agencies and entities including Veterans Affairs, Department of Defense, Defense Logistics Agency, and National Institute of Health, and more. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.



If this sounds like an environment where you can thrive, keep reading!



Our Salesforce Project Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing the implementation and execution of Salesforce projects within the organization. We're seeking Salesforce team members to help modernize and enhance enterprise system that connects healthcare providers directly with millions of US veterans seeking clinical care. This role involves collaborating with various stakeholders, including business leaders, developers, and administrators, to ensure successful planning, deployment, and optimization of Salesforce solutions.



**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**



* Develop and execute project plans, defining project scope, goals, deliverables, and timelines.
* Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and align project objectives with organizational goals.
* Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, administrators, and business analysts.
* Foster effective communication and coordination among team members to ensure project milestones are met.
* Oversee that configuration and customization of Salesforce meets business needs.
* Ensure Salesforce team is following best practices and industry standards.
* Identify potential risks and issues that may impact project timelines or deliverables.

title: Sr - Data Center/Cloud Project Manager
description:

**Hello,**

**My name is Ashna Kapoor and I am a Staffing Specialist at BuzzClan. I am reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one of our clients.**

· Identification of alternatives and options for future computing needs

The major phases outlined, will bring forth a deep understanding and evaluation of the needs and costs for on-prem, co-location, cloud based and hybrid solutions. This will span the existing foot-print in Groton and other smaller sites whose needs can be more effectively solved through additional consolidation.

· Project management

title: Cloud Technical Project Manager
description:
**If you're looking for a position with a company that values innovation in all that we do, value-orientation in all choices and decisions, and has an employee-centric company focus, you've come to the right place.** Simple Technology Solutions' motivated team members deliver remarkable solutions to our Federal Government clients every day. We are lifelong learners, value outcomes over busy-ness and cultivate collaboration over individual contributions.



Our in-depth experience helping government agencies in their installation, configuration, and optimization of leading Agile Software Development, DevOps, and Cloud Migration tools has led to rapid growth and an increased demand for our services. This growing team has an exciting startup feel, but we are not new to the game. As experienced government contractors, we are mentors, coaches, and thought leaders, who pride ourselves in sharing our knowledge and expertise with those growing within our organization.


**A Little More About STS**



You don't get named a "Best Place to Work" by the Washington Business Journal, receive the Washington Technology magazine's FAST50 status, and achieve Inc Magazine's "Inc 500" status just by 'talking the talk'. Our vision of excellence is aligned to our 'Techquity' (Tech-Equity) focus and drive. We understand that disparities and gaps in opportunities and earning potential exist for marginalized groups, such as people of color and women, in the IT industry. By leveraging the power, passion, and talent from this group we are able to deliver innovative GovCon IT solutions that exceed our customer's expectations.



Our team members are not just 'employees'; they're parents, friends, volunteers, artists, students, athletes, and all of the other things that make them whole people. The flexibility that STS offers allows them to balance their personal lives while providing the top-notch services our customers have come to depend on.



 Additionally, the team benefits from our partnerships with AWS, Google, Microsoft and CloudBees – with access to improved knowledge and the opportunity to become a SME with one or more of our above partners. At Simple Technology Solutions, we don't see Team Member benefits as 'perks'. Taking care of the people who take care of us is the standard. Click our benefits infographic to learn more about our industry-leading options that attract and retain top talent. But don't just take our word for it, see what our current team members say about us on Glassdoor.



Simple Technology Solutions is a 8(a) HUBZone Company and we offer an annual $5,000 HUBZone bonus to team members that live in a qualified HUBZone and provide the required supporting documentation. To see if you could qualify for an annual HUBZone bonus, check out the HUBZone map **HERE****.**

**Cloud Technical Project Manager**



Simple Technology Solutions (STS) is looking for a **Cloud Technical Project Manager** to add to our team.



This role will provide direct oversight and management of a complex application modernization project involving multiple subcontractors and vendors, and engagement with executive stakeholders. Required skills include Agile Project Management, IT service delivery management, and IT tactical and strategic planning.


**Quick overview:**


* This position is Full-Time-Remote
* US Citizenship is required to obtain required clearance
* Bachelor's degree is required
* 3 Years of IT Experience in managing, building, operating, and improving Cloud Computing environments in Azure or AWS
* An Agile certification is preferred (eg. CSCM, SAFe)


**The role:**



Simple Technology Solutions' Cloud Technical Project Manager embraces being a leader and will guide teams in delivering on client contracts and translate needs into powerful solutions. They are a problem-solver with demonstrated experience in developing and maintaining customer required methodologies, procedures, metrics, and systems to produce reports to measure program success. The Cloud Technical Project Manager is collaborative, forward thinking, and has exceptional communication skills to facilitate team's success. While the Project Manager will be primarily responsible for managing project delivery of cloud migration work (Azure and AWS) with 30+ customer tenants, they will also be responsible for creating and tracking all Cloud Engineering and Operations work in Jira, managing contract deliverables (weekly and monthly reports), presenting and conducting customer meetings, as well as other related duties as assigned.


**The Cloud Technical Project Manager at STS will:**


* Communicate with diverse customer stakeholder groups, including executive management, and require consensus building
* Have overall responsibility for all financial, technical, administrative, contractual, and personnel aspects of the Cloud Engineering Tenant Support contract and will interface with Customer executives
* Be prepared to provide sound advice as to prioritizing projects or tasks and when to delay
* Change and Configuration Management best practices
* Enforce quality standards for engineered solutions
* Issue escalation to internal and external stakeholders where appropriate
* Deliver using an Agile approach with an emphasis on automation, MVPs, and end user/business user engagement
* Lead an engineering team across three functional areas on a program providing cloud platform services for customer tenants. Provide program management support, manage multiple ongoing platform enhancement projects, tenant migration projects, as well as managing engineering operations support customer tenant systems.
* Lead engineering team agile ceremonies – facilitate daily stand-up meetings, sprint planning, sprint review, backlog grooming, and collaborate on road map development with architects and government stakeholders
* Manage onboarding for tenants to Cloud platforms (AWS and Azure) – collaborate with tenants to schedule, coordinate resources, manage risk, and provide status on migration projects
* Manage engineering operations and maintenance efforts for Cloud tenants – collaborate with cross-functional teams for change implementations to ensure compliance with organizational and change management policies.
* Oversee tasking, resource assignment, and ensure timely resolution of support requests
* Platform strategy – collaborate with senior stakeholders and technical resources to identify business needs and platform improvement opportunities.
* Align and prioritize platform initiatives with organizational strategic objectives.
* Collaborate with senior stakeholders to influence process improvement to increase efficiency and operational throughput.
* Identify and assist in developing solutions for process gaps and new business needs
* Develop, analyze, and validate business metrics – resource utilization, performance and compliance, status, and risk analysis data
* Manage ongoing external and internal relationships and generate new strategic opportunities and scope expansion on the assigned contract(s)
* Present project status reports and facilitate product demos for our team and clients
* Assist in the design and execution of usability tests, analysis of results, and creation of finding and recommendations documentation including user stories, presentations, and reports
* Manage complex spend plans and ensure program aspects are operating within established budgets
* Successful implementation and turn-up of customer network solutions
* Direct interface to the customer and STS senior leadership on service-related issues
* Manage required escalations to address customer service delivery issues
* Establish and maintain a firm understanding of the Client's IT infrastructure
* Assist with Vendor and Asset Management


**Experience, Education, and Certifications:**


*Required*


* Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Business Administration Science, Mathematics, or Engineering or a related field
* 3 Years of IT Experience in managing, building, operating, and improving Cloud Computing environments in Azure or AWS
* Experience leading and collaborating with technical teams of diverse IT related skill sets
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of Azure and AWS Cloud environments and deploying in Government environments
* Extensive knowledge of managing work in Jira (or similar work tracking systems) and ability to prepare useful reports to foster data-driven decision making
* Exemplary communication, analytical skills, and technical knowledge across the client environment that facilitates resolving technical issues in customer cloud migrations
* Facilitating meetings, workshops, and discussions with team members and clients to align user wants, client needs, technical level of effort, and timelines
* Budgeting and forecasting of renewals and strategic initiatives
* Providing continuous improvement of Client service delivery processes, documentation, and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
* Demonstrated experience managing cloud projects in agile environment
* Knowledge of cloud services, methodologies, best practices, and tools
* Technical PM background in ITIL, Agile, DevOps, Hybrid cloud infrastructure, collaboration tools


*Nice to Have*


* Project Management Institute (PMI) certified Project Management Professional (PMP)
* Agile certification (eg. CSCM, SAFe)
* Cloud practitioner-level certs for Azure and AWS

  



Simple Technology Solutions pays an annual $5,000 HUBZone bonus to team members that live in a qualified HUBZone and provide the required supporting HUBZone documentation. To see if you could qualify for an annual HUBZone bonus, check out the HUBZone map **HERE**.

 *Simple Technology Solutions, Inc. (STS) requires all team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious exemption is approved by STS. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination OR apply for a religious/medical accommodation OR show proof of state exemption prior to the first day of employment. Failure to meet these requirements may affect your employment eligibility with STS.*  

  

*STS is committed to equal employment opportunity. STS provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination, harassment, and retaliation of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, family responsibilities, matriculation, personal appearance, political affiliation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*  

  

*This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*
*-*
*Applicants may request removal from our applicant database, or specific information about how the data is used by contacting* *recruiting@simpletechnology.io.*

title: Professional Services Project Manager | CPQ
description:
General information
**Office (s)**Remote, US


**Date Published**Thursday, February 29, 2024


**Country**United States


**Job ID**23850


**Function**Professional Services


**Recruiter**Olagbaju, Fehintola


**Salary Range**50,000 - 140,000


Description & Requirements
**Professional Services Project Manager | CPQ**


The Project Manager is responsible for leading the implementation of Epicor CPQ projects from contract signing to delivery from scope of work through timelines. You will act as the main point of contact between the client and Epicor’s team ensuring exceptional communication, setting expectations and constant communication.

**What you will be doing:**

* Document the scope for Epicor CPQ projects for customers.
* Manage deliverables, meetings, and progress completion for configurator projects.
* Act as a main point of contact for the customer during the configurator implementation process.
* Ensure that the project team and customers adhere to project schedule.
* Document and manage project scope changes, communicate revised project schedules and facilitate change orders for customer approval.
* Keep the leadership team informed on project status such as: identifying risks, tests, costs, issues, and performance to established targets on a regular basis.
* Monitor business and technical issues to establish what is currently being done and identify potential improvements.
* Manage project closure reporting to ensure orders are closed in a timely manner.
* Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
* Provide occasional technical support and customer service to end-users via telephone, e-mail, and webinars.
* Telecommute with occasional meetings at our Austin office or customer sites in the US and Europe.

**What you will likely bring:**

* Ability to work independently while being self-driven, and meeting multiple deadlines
* Customer-facing experience
* Strong communication skills both written and verbal
* Familiarity with Enterprise Software (e.g. ERP, CRM, CAD, PDM, etc.)
* Familiar with remote work environments and capable of working in a virtual office environment
* Familiarity working with clients of all sizes
* Overnight travel of up to 25%

**Qualification:**

* 2+ years of software project management experience and demonstrated success/knowledge.
* Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience)
* PMP Certification is a plus
* Experience with both Waterfall and Agile methodologies preferred
* Experience working at or with manufacturing companies preferred


**The Professional Services Team**


Professional Services play an instrumental role in the growth of Epicor. You will be working with our customers to implement our products and ensure that we continuously provide an exceptional customer experience. Almost every position is customer-facing—therefore, it’s important to have energy, drive, and determination to ensure Epicor gives the best possible experience to all clients. This passion will contribute to the success of your career and the company. If you are looking for a global, innovative company with strong roots and exciting growth, Epicor is ready to hear from you!


**About Epicor**


At Epicor we know that success comes from working together. Everyone has a role to play, and it’s the essential partnerships across our company that are crucial to our customers’ success and our growth as a business.


We’re truly a team. Working in close partnership, we bring wide-ranging talents together in powerful collaborations. We think innovatively, share our knowledge generously, and constantly learn from our colleagues. We’re proud of the success we achieve every day, but we never stop challenging ourselves and encouraging each other. Together, we go further and imagine an even brighter future.


Whatever your career journey, we’ll help you find the right path. Through our training courses, mentorship, and continuous support, you’ll get everything you need to thrive. At Epicor, your success is our success. And that success really matters, because we’re the essential partners for the world’s most essential businesses—the hardworking companies who make, move, and sell the things the world needs.


**Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement**


Epicor is committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is valued; where you bring the whole and real you—that’s who we’re interested in. If you have interest in this or any role- but your experience doesn’t match every qualification of the job description, that’s okay- consider applying regardless.


We are an equal-opportunity employer.


Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location.

  

At Epicor, we care about your health and financial wellness, as well as your work-life balance. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefit offerings including medical coverages, dental, and vision, as well as other wellness programs. In addition, we offer a 401(k) match, HSA and FSA plans, a student debt program, a wide variety of insurance coverages, and voluntary benefits to achieve financial wellness. We also value your work-life balance and offer flexible time off, paid holidays, and paid maternity and parental leave. Please note that this is for information purposes only and provides a summary of Epicor's benefit offering.

related to architecting, designing, coding, testing and deployment in support of new applications  
being built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform using Microsoft and non-Microsoft cloud  
solutions, and related technologies (e.g., Office 365, Power BI, etc.) to meet our business

and Deliver application, infrastructure, and middleware components on an agreed upon  
timeline.

infrastructure service solutions / delivery including network connectivity, midrange server build,  
virtual server build, storage, performance / capacity planning, and monitoring of infrastructure  
health.

Management, Production Release Management, Performance testing and Capacity  
Management plus other teams to deliver Pre-Prod and Production infrastructure in the

planning and management to ensure that all assigned projects are completed on time, within

including but not limited to project status reporting (including financial KPIs), project planning,
