title: Technical Project Manager 4
description:
**Boston Government Services is seeking a Technical Project Manager to support the** **Line-Item Projects/ALDPI group to manage day-to-day administrative/operational management of all activities and functions in a designated program area within a line staff department at Los Alamos National Laboratory.**

  

Boston Government Services (BGS) is an engineering, technology, and security firm helping to advance missions of national importance for government programs, national laboratories, national security facilities, nuclear operations, and complex projects. We support clients at every stage, from strategic planning and program management to the execution of engineering and technical activities. We work to attract and retain the best talent because the best talent delivers the best results for our clients. Our capabilities are based on our experience in complex, secure, and highly regulated environments. We leverage our experience and capabilities to provide mission-driven solutions tuned to our client's mission needs and strategic direction.

 **We are passionate about our culture!** At BGS, we hire people who will bring their whole self to work each day because we value operating with openness and inclusivity, welcoming and respecting all. BGS cares for each employees’ well-being by offering a comprehensive benefit package and providing a culture of exciting work, excellence, and fun.

  



If you align with BGS’ company values and culture, we would love for you to explore opportunities to join our growing team by checking out the job description below!

  



**Responsibilities:**

* Manages and ensures timely completion of discrete technical or operational projects.
* Establishes technical requirements for the project, defines project deliverables, budgets schedules and risks.
* Oversees project team in the planning, tracking, and execution of the project from initiation to completion.
* Develop, execute, and deliver work packages.
* Contribute to the development, implementation and evaluation of program policies, procedures, and standards; determines service levels and enhancements.
* Assists with the development and monitoring of program budgets.
* Provides technical advice to staff and other departments; performs related work as required.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.
* Minimum of twelve years of related experience. Or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* This position is Remote with some travel/onsite requirements working a 4/10 work schedule. Richland Duty Station due to proximity of project team and fabricators. Occasional trips to Los Alamos (on boarding and meetings on an “as-needed” basis).
* Must be US citizen.
* Successful drug screening.
* Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Q security clearance badge.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Prefer prior DOE experience supporting D&D, environmental restoration and 413.3B construction projects, using EVMS programs including P6 and Cobra.
* Ability to successfully plan, organize, lead, and monitor a wide variety of team efforts to completion.
* Ability to prepare and deliver performance status communications to all levels of management, both internal and external.

 **Benefits:**


Boston Government Services offers a competitive total compensation package. Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Paid Vacation, 401K, Long and Short-Term Disability.

  



Starting compensation for this role typically **salary ranges between $140,000 and $150,000 annually** is commensurate with experience relative to the position and may vary based on candidate geographical location.

 **EEO:**

*Boston Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.*

title: Salesforce Platform Manager
description:
Rush Street Interactive (NYSE: RSI) is a market leader in online casino and sports betting, currently operating real-money gaming with our brands: BetRivers.com, PlaySugarHouse.com, and RushBet.co. We're building bridges between online, social and land-based gaming businesses to create amazing, integrated experiences that keep players in the game.


As a Salesforce Platform Manager, you will own the integrity and strength of the Salesforce platform and other solutions as required. You'll act as a trusted advisor to our team and clients, and an effective mentor for other professionals working alongside you. You will have a deep understanding of the Salesforce platform but just as importantly, top-notch people skills to get your ideas and solutions across to stakeholders and gain integrity to get your visions built into successful solutions. The Salesforce Platform Manager is the face of the Salesforce platform to the business, responsible for the overall management of the platform. They are responsible for leading project initiatives, gathering requirements, designing solutions, and implementing configurations on the Salesforce instance. They develop methodology and best practices for relevant teams, and drive platform adoption of all users. They manage the Salesforce roadmap and all platform initiatives. They will be involved in growth strategy discussions alongside relevant stakeholders.



This is a varied delivery leadership role, with the following responsibilities:


* Conduct research into use of Salesforce, producing a report of findings with recommended steps and a roadmap for Salesforce solutions
* Collaborate with relevant operational teams to create prototypes and proofs of concept as a means of eliciting and defining requirements
* Review solutions and recommending improvements
* Groom and refine the Salesforce product backlog, in liaison with stakeholders on the project
* Own the design of Salesforce and other affiliated solutions for all relevant teams
* Act as a release manager, approving configuration, and coded items to be deployed between environments. Where appropriate, this could include deploying changes
* Provide guidance on user story writing style
* Ensure success and acceptance criteria are defined for each story
* Describe and illustrate designs with appropriate justifications
* Ensure documentation of the steps for testing
* Groom and refine the Salesforce product backlog, in liaison with relevant internal and external stakeholders
* Supervise the configuration, quality assurance, testing, and deployment of Salesforce
* Weigh duties as appropriate to reflect importance and/or time expended on each
* Partner with Operations leaders to determine Salesforce needs and opportunities
* Act as Project Manager for all enhancement and maintenance projects related to Salesforce
* Develop and maintain a backlog of enhancements and fixes
* Manage consulting/development partners
* Communicate and report project status to Operations leadership and IT management, including budget, risks, and general business issues
* Responsible for the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance, and improvement of our database
* Maintain and optimize Workflows, Process Builders, Flows, custom settings, page layouts, Lightning pages etc.
* Own the user adoption of the Salesforce platform
* Develop and deliver training for teams as necessary
* Maintain adoption dashboards and data-quality dashboards, reviewing regularly for indication of adoption improvement needs
* Respond to requests for immediate issues. Troubleshoot issues and identify related solution or user training requirements
* Stay updated on the platform's new tools, capabilities, and updates
* Manage any system code/configuration changes required related to Salesforce releases
* Assist with special projects as directed by leadership


**Required Skills:**


* Minimum Salesforce certified:
	+ Administrator
	+ Sales Cloud Consultant
	+ Service Cloud Consultant
	+ Platform App Builder
* Strong understanding of Salesforce Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Pardot and other CRM technology solutions
* Experience leading discovery workshops, including solution presentations and prototype demonstrations
* Certified Salesforce Administrator or Developer
* Ability to work well with people including project stakeholders and project team members
* Proactive desire to continue to broaden and deepen business and consulting skills
* Ability to work both independently and within a team
* Capable of managing a variety of complex issues while driving momentum of key projects
* Strategic mindset and exceptional communication skills
* A pro-active personality, with a can-do attitude
* Excellent communication skills, written, verbal, and interactive when online
* Excellent relationship-building skills
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to observe trends. Able to actively make suggestions based on the results
* Available and responsive to question, clarifications, and instructions
* Ability to tailor communication to multiple audiences at all levels
* A self-starter, experienced in leading projects or delivery work streams
* Ability to demonstrate concepts visually and in writing in a way that enables stakeholders to decide with confidence
* A strategic approach to solution design, with proven ability to develop and execute tactical plans to support the strategy


As a rapidly growing company in an emerging industry, you'll have a huge impact on our product and our company. We like proactive team members and strive to have a company of self-disciplined professionals who enjoy collaboration, having fun, and of course, achieving together what others believe to be improbable. We are dedicated to treating everyone with respect and to support your professional and personal growth.



Rush Street Interactive is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity, and expression, marital status, family status, lifestyle, age, culture, religion, military, and veteran status, citizenship, or disability.



Be at the forefront of this ground-breaking industry! Apply now!

title: Technical Project Manager [Real Estate Clients]
description:
***If you do not have experience working with real estate organizations, please do not apply.*** 

**About Us**

D2D Consulting is the go-to resource for project management and software implementation services. Providing customized development, quality assurance testing, data validation, comprehensive training and help desk support, D2D Consulting offers full end-to-end management and delivery of our client’s processes. D2D Consulting distinguishes themselves with a unique combination of deep business operations knowledge and technology expertise. As a result, we have become a trusted business partner who shares our clients’ vision, achieving a 100% client retention rate and 100% on-time and on-budget project implementation.

**Role and Responsibilities**

* Develop project management plans, schedules, budgets, and team management practices to ensure on-time, on-budget delivery of multiple projects.
* Identifying opportunities and solutions to optimize projects and internal business operations
* Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects.
* Provide reports to executives and internal leadership on project progress, challenges, and areas for improvement
* Develop change management plans for projects or other initiatives, evaluates the impact of organizational change, identifies, and address potential risk, and manages anticipated resistance to change.
* Identify and communicate project risks and appropriately mitigating risk utilizing and a mitigation plan
* Creating unity across project team members and effectively managing consistent, cohesive communication between all parties
* Initiating and running project meetings designed to minimize challenges and maximize efficiency
* Properly document meeting action items and decisions and maintaining project artifacts.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple priorities, while driving decisions and alignment with leadership, direct reports, and cross-functional teams
* Prepare internal and external reports pertaining to job status weekly and monthly based on project need.
* Negotiate terms of agreements, draft contracts and coordinate permits and licenses on behalf of the client.
* Serves as prime contact on contracts or projects through all phases of development
* Creates, builds, and develops interpersonal relationships between D2D, clients, and vendors.
* Effectively manages a variety of work to required standards of quality, quantity, and timeliness.
* Initiate, develop, coordinate, and implement strategic product implementation and maintenance plans.
* Contributes to D2D growth by sourcing work through net new and/or existing clients
* Travel based on client need, resource availability, and within CDC recommended safety guidelines.

**Qualifications and Education Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or 5 years of equivalent experience.
* Extensive leadership experience managing both direct and indirect reports and vendor resources.
* Innate problem-solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture.
* Candidates with a growth mindset who want to see their networking and relationship-building skills to increase expansion.
* Entrepreneurial spirit for tenaciously and proactively solving project challenges and enhancing the client experience.
* Minimum three years management experience in the IT field, including development work and interaction with customers.

**Preferred Skills**

* 5 or more years of project management experience
* Experience with Yardi, JD Edwards, Great Plains, Entrata, RealPage, MRI, Salesforce, and HRIS systems such as UKG UltiPro, ISIMS and other similar software.
* Relevant certification in project management (PMP, ITIL, CMM, etc.) are preferred but not required.

**D2D Consultant Expectations**

* Consultants are expected to be prepared for the workday and report or events/meetings on time. In instances when employees cannot avoid being late or are unable to work as scheduled, they are to notify their supervisor as soon as possible. Employees must also communicate to the client(s) of any delays. Frequent or unscheduled absences and repeated lateness may result in disciplinary action.
* Consultants are expected to resent a clean, neat, and tasteful appearance appropriate to their position whenever representing D2D.
* Consultants are required to submit work time into the tine management system by the end of every Friday in order to receive payment,
* During work hours, employees are to conduct duties related to their jobs at D2D.
* Consultants are not to conduct work for competitors unless authorized to do so.
* Theft, unauthorized removal, negligence, destruction, or misuse of D2D property, property of D2D colleagues, or D2D clients is prohibited.
* Consultants who are members of outside professional organizations are to ensure that their involvement in those organizations does not negatively affect their ability to perform their job duties.
* Consultants will communicate regularly to direct management and report status of all projects on a minimum of a weekly basis.
* Consultants will not discriminate, harass, or unfairly treat colleagues or clients because of their race, skin color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation) religion, disability, age, or genetic information.

**Consultant Benefits** 

* Qualifying Sale Commission Opportunities
* Time off on major holidays

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* How many years experience working with real estate developers/property managers?

Experience:

* Project management: 5 years (Required)
* Yardi: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: ServiceNow Program Manager
description:
Seeking: ServiceNow Program Manager


Who We Are:


The Anti is a solution-driven, forward-thinking, culture-focused organization. We drive successful implementations that deliver value to our customers NOW. We're fluent in ServiceNow, we're fluent in HR, and we're uniquely positioned to become the leading partner in Employee Experience solutions powered by ServiceNow.


What We're Looking For:


Program Manager. The Program Manager is an intricate member and leader of our project teams who instinctively knows how to lead a large team of resources to ensure successful program execution. Understands the need to manage multiple, large-scale, complex project work plans and workstreams with extensive knowledge of what works and more importantly... what doesn't work.


What You Will Do:


* Serve as primary contact for professional service projects on the ServiceNow platform to internal and external stakeholders
* Manage a program execution plan encompassing all implementation workstreams with respect to project financials, progress tracking, metrics, executing change control measures and overall successful program delivery
* Strong ability to influence multiple stakeholders with a willingness to take on tasks to get the job done
* Indirectly manage cross-functional teams; demonstrating exceptional organization skills and attention to detail
* Dedicated to conflict resolution management, active listening and interpersonal skills
* Monitor progress, resources and workstreams to ensure efficiency and maximize deliverables
* Own program outcomes and risks with associated mitigation plans to key stakeholders
* Lead project initiation, project execution, and project close activities
* Coordinate and schedule key workshops, and development, testing, and deployment activities with customers
* Engage in timely and effective communications to customers, provides status reports, and facilitate executive steering committee meetings
* Demonstrate expert understanding of project management methodologies and principles
* Develop a keen understanding of the products we implement and our customer's business
* Participates in pre-sales activities as needed
* Deliver excellence
* Be agile, stay agile


What You Need:


* 2+ years experience implementing ServiceNow programs consisting of 3+ workstreams
* Experience working for the U.S. federal government or supporting the U.S federal government in a consulting capacity
* 5+ years experience as a consultant implementing enterprise solutions
* 5+ years of project management experience
* First-class communication and presentation skills with executive stakeholders
* US Citizenship is required (required by the federal government for this position)
* Must currently reside in the United States and able to perform work in the United States as this work is for a federal contract and laws do apply
* Must be able to obtain Public Trust clearance
* Strong interpersonal skills, customer-centric attitude
* Drop the ME and work as WE
* Ability to travel up to 25-30%


What We Offer:


* Competitive Health Benefits
* 401K with a 3% contribution
* Vacation, Volunteer time, and Sabbatical benefits
* World Class co-workers


The Anti is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer -race/ color/ religion/sex/ sexual orientation/ national origin/age/ disability/ gender identity/veteran status.

title: Business Continuity (COOP) Technical Project Manager
description:
Peraton is seeking a **Business Continuity Technical Project Manager** to join our team of qualified and diverse individuals. The qualified applicant will directly support operations and business continuity readiness through project management, coordination support, technical writing and assist with team deliverables. This work will require subject matter expertise in Continuity of Operations (COOP) planning and Business Continuity operations; IT operations centers and IT incident management emergency preparedness and incident management, Test, Training, and Exercise (TT&E) development and execution; a variety of software tools; technical writing; and project management.

Must be local to the DC Metro area.

**Day to Day Work Responsibilities::** 

* Serve as project manager for cross-functional teams of 30+ people to develop and maintain Business Continuity and COOP documentation, including but not limited to policies, standards, governance models, program procedures, run-books, tools and templates.
* Coordinate with business functions to update Business Continuity Program activities such as tabletop, functional and full-scale exercises.
* Manage and track projects and action items relating to the business continuity management project.
* Conduct the annual plan review of all BCP and COOP plans, complete rating scorecard and manage plan review approval process ensuring all planners and managers sign-off.
* Assist with facilitating regular capability planning and information-sharing forums, to include scheduling meetings, developing meeting materials, and documenting and tracking action items.
* Responsible for communicating project status across delivery teams, senior leaders, and cross-functional stakeholders.
* Assist with Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery (BC/DR) with the COOP Support activities, to include tracking local and national weather and natural hazard events, writing situation reports, and tracking deployed assets.
* Partner with customer to maintain and develop operations and exercise content in the ServiceNow knowledge base and CMDB.
* Attend Business Impact Analysis and other project related working groups and the coordination and scheduling of meetings as required, assisting BC by writing meeting summaries and documenting action items associate with the Business Impact Analysis.
* Attend project and other working groups and coordination meetings as required, assisting BC by documenting actions items.
* Travel to alternate sites for capability development and assessments, and in support of continuity planning and exercise planning and execution.
* Stay abreast of current continuity standards, best practices, technologies, and other resources from industry and government, bringing suggestions to BC staff.
* Manage multiple initiatives, driving timely decisions.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* U.S. Citizenship required; must have the ability to obtain/maintain a Public Trust clearance.
* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Communications, Human IT Management, Homeland Security, Emergency/Crisis Management or a related field with 5 years’ experience or MS degree and 3 years’ experience or high school diploma/equivalent and minimum 9 years’ experience.
* 5+ years’ experience in business continuity, crisis planning, emergency management, and technical project/change management.
* Ability to operate in a fast paced and high stress operations environment while managing multiple streams of work simultaneously is required.
* Strong communicator, ability to concisely communicate complex information.
* Experience with Agile development methodology.
* Experience with Business Continuity and related principles/standards.
* MS Office Proficiency (Excel, Power Point, Word, and Project).
* Experience with trouble ticketing system—currently using Service Manager.
* Strong ITIL service management knowledge around service design, change management, incident management, and continuity management.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certified Business Continuity Professional (DRII CBCP) or equivalent industry certification and Certified Emergency Manager (CEM) or equivalents preferred.
* PMP Certification/Six Sigma Certification.
* Expertise with Enterprise Change Standards.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* ITIL service management: 5 years (Required)
* technical project/change management: 5 years (Required)
* crisis planning, emergency management: 5 years (Required)
* Continuity of Operations (COOP) planning: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Technical Project Manager I
description:
Fueled by our shared passion and expertise, CDW delivers innovative technology solutions for our customers. We’re also committed to fostering an environment that embraces collaboration, celebrates integrity, inclusivity, and individuality, and paves the path for personal and professional growth. Experience a life in balance and join us on the journey forward.



The Technical Project Manager manages complex projects and Agile value streams, which are highly visible and critical to the business. The Technical Project Manager communicates with team members and stakeholders effectively and understands how to motivate and lead teams, projects, and people in a resource-intensive, highly demanding and rapidly changing business environment. This role requires maintaining day-to-day tasks, the product delivery, and the project’s overall success. The Technical Project Manager is also responsible for change management activities at all levels of the organizations.



What you will do:


* Plan, build, and run technology-based solutions consistent with CDW’s implementation methodology.
* Manage and deliver programs and projects within stated targets.
* Responsible for the delivery of effective change management by consistent application of the change management process and the correct integration of tools, platforms, applications and resources.
* Management of IT Application and Infrastructure change requests, approvals and the scheduled releases into the production environment.
* Deliver customer facing and internal change management activities to ensure ongoing stakeholder and user engagement.
* Coach and guide team members how to optimize their efficiency within the project team best.
* Helping the team achieve a high level of performance and quality, holding teams accountable for their work.
* Defining the deliverable's schedule and scope while balancing this with timely and regular value deliveries, and organizing and leading team scrum, planning meetings.
* Supporting the product owner in managing communications with stakeholders, managing business stakeholder's expectations for deliverables.
* Ensure project artifacts such as user stories, definition of done, acceptance criteria, and test cases are properly documented.
* Identify and address impediments and blockers, recognize and manage risks, dependencies, escalating when necessary.
* Utilize tools such as ServiceNow to track team progress, productivity, velocity, and individual performance.
* Measure and report on team performance and progress, as well as identify opportunities for improvement.




**What we expect of you:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or demonstrated equivalent experience required.
* Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications.
* Understanding of how organizations go through a change and the change process.
* Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools.
* Demonstrated through problem solving skills with an understanding of process excellence.
* Proven track record of managing costs, schedules, and scope.
* The ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a matrix organization.
* Excellent written and verbal and communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate across the company and departments at all levels.
* The ability to support the needs of the project team and internal stakeholders, while holding team members accountable for completion.
* Successful history in decomposing business objectives into a series of associated projects and manage deliverables through project teams.
* Master's Degree, a plus
* Industry Certifications (PMP, CBAP, Six Sigma), a plus


**About us**  

**We make technology work so people can do great things.**

CDW is a Fortune 500 technology solutions provider to business, government, education, and healthcare organizations across the globe. At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re your long-term, full-stack, full-lifecycle technology partner. We have the experience, expertise, scale, relationships and deep industry knowledge to bring just about any vision to life. Together, we can deliver the full promise of what technology can do. Together, we Make Amazing Happen.



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
**Technical Project Manager**

**Delivery Manager I**

**Who we are:**

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.


UST is a mission-driven group of over 39,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.


With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.


Visit us at UST.com .  



**You Are:**

UST is searching for a Technical Project Manager who under guidance deliverS large and complex programmes within budget and schedule to meet outcomes as outlined.; adhering to defined processes and quality standards for a portfolio with TCV of $3-5 mil. Responsible for tracking operational and logistic decision making and implementing a robust governance model involving internal and customer stakeholders.

* Communicate project status, issues and risks timely to all stake holders, cross functional teams and managers.

Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.

We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Oracle Cloud HCM - Project Manager
description:
**Project Manager – Oracle**

**Company Overview:**  

Argano is a leading global digital consultancy, dedicated to driving business transformation through strategic consulting and technology delivery. We specialize in optimizing business operations across Oracle, SAP, Microsoft, and Salesforce platforms. Our mission is to enhance agility, profitability, and growth for our clients, leveraging our expertise in business applications, cloud, data & analytics, automation, and AI.


**Role Overview:**  

As a Project Manager in Argano's Oracle consulting business, you will lead and manage Oracle Cloud HCM implementation projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and on budget. You will play a crucial role in delivering high-quality Oracle Cloud solutions to our clients, aligning with Argano's commitment to excellence in digital transformation.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Project Leadership:**
	+ Lead Oracle Cloud HCM implementation projects from initiation to closure, adhering to our project management principles and practices.
	+ Develop and execute project plans, establish staffing requirements, and adjust as needed throughout the project lifecycle.
	+ Manage project risks, actions, issues, and decisions, and drive completion by the team.
* **Stakeholder Management:**
	+ Work closely with stakeholders, team members, and senior management to ensure project success.
	+ Maintain clear and regular communication with all parties involved, providing updates on project progress, challenges, and achievements.
* **Quality Assurance:**
	+ Ensure that project deliverables meet the required quality standards and client expectations.
	+ Implement quality control processes and conduct quality reviews.
* **Budget Management:**
	+ Maintain and manage a Project Budget Tracker/Burn Sheet to ensure the allocated budget is not exceeded.
* **Team Leadership:**
	+ Assemble project teams, assign tasks, and manage resources.
	+ Foster collaboration and communication among team members.

**Requirements:**


* **Education:**
	+ Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
	+ MBA or relevant master's degree preferred.
* **Experience:**
	+ 5 to 10 years of experience in project management.
	+ Minimum of 3+ years of experience managing Oracle Cloud HCM implementation projects.
	+ Comprehensive understanding of Oracle Cloud HCM applications, including Core HR, Talent Management, Learning, Recruitment, Time& Labor, Absence Payroll and Benefits
	+ Proven experience in managing complex projects with cross-functional teams.
* **Skills:**
	+ Proficiency in project management methodologies and best practices.
	+ Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	+ Strong leadership skills and ability to provide guidance and support to ensure successful project execution.
	+ Familiarity with project management tools and software, such as Smartsheet, JIRA, Trello, or Microsoft Project.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our clients' Oracle Cloud implementations and to be part of Argano's journey as a leader in digital transformation. If you are a driven project manager with a passion for delivering exceptional results, we invite you to join our dynamic team at Argano.


The base compensation range for this position is $120,000 - $170,000 commensurate with experience. Argano also offers a performance-based bonus and strong benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Parental Leave, and Flexible Time Off

title: Channel Program Manager
description:
**Position:** **Channel Program Manager**  

At Pharos, we celebrate diversity, inclusion, and innovation. We are a dynamic company that values openness, commitment, respect, and a bit of fun. As a leading player in the technology space, Pharos is riding the wave of a transformative era, especially in the migration of print IT infrastructure to the cloud. Our cutting-edge technology caters to large enterprises, and our impressive client base includes globally recognized companies.  

  

**Role Overview:**  

Pharos is seeking a **Channel Program Manager** to join our Sales team. The Channel Program Manager plays a vital role in maintaining strong relationships within our partner landscape. This position entails a diverse set of responsibilities focused on supporting our channel partners and the growth of Pharos through those partners. Key tasks include responding to various partner inquiries, creating quotes in alignment with the partner agreement, allocating Pharos resources to projects appropriately, and managing the day-to-day activities of channel support. Strong organizational & communication skills are essential in this role. The Channel Program Manager's role is crucial to the company's success as they act as the primary liaison between Pharos and its partners, ensuring seamless collaboration and maximizing opportunities for mutual growth and success.  

  

**Pay Range**: Base of USD$75,000-USD$80,000 per year and a bonus target of USD$10,000 per year.  

  

**Location**: Candidates must reside in the United States. Candidates in the Rochester New York, Las Vegas, or the Denver area will be given preference.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

**Support Channel partners in selling Pharos solutions:**+ Assist channel partners in understanding Pharos solutions, including features, benefits, and value propositions.
+ Provide training, resources, and guidance to channel partners to effectively market and sell Pharos solutions**.**

**Build Expertise within the channel teams to foster “self-service” mentality:**+ Develop training programs and resources to empower channel teams to become subject matter experts on Pharos solutions.
+ Promote a culture of continuous learning and skill development within channel teams to enhance their ability to independently address customer needs.

**Create and deliver powerful presentations that clearly communicate the uniqueness of Pharos:**+ Develop compelling presentation materials that highlight the key features, benefits, and differentiators of Pharos solutions.
+ Deliver presentations to channel partners and potential customers with confidence and clarity.

**Manage orders and requests we get from our partners:**+ Process orders and requests from partners in a timely and accurate manner.
+ Coordinate with internal teams, such as Sales Operations and Customer Support, to ensure smooth order fulfillment and resolution of partner inquiries.

**Effectively communicate client needs to the Sales Engineering teams to drive future product enhancements:**+ Gather feedback from channel partners and customers regarding product performance and feature requests.
+ Collaborate with Sales Engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements and communicate customer needs effectively.

**Collaborate with Marketing teams to develop targeted marketing materials and campaigns:**+ Work closely with Marketing teams to create marketing collateral, such as brochures, case studies, and presentations, tailored to the needs of channel partners.
+ Assist in the development of targetedmarketing campaigns to generate leads and support channel sales efforts.

**Establish and maintain a robust feedback loop with Channel partners:**+ Regularly solicit feedback from channel partners on market trends, customer preferences, and competitor activities.
+ Analyze feedback to identify opportunities for improvement and inform strategic decision-making and product development efforts.

**Provide ongoing guidance and support to Channel partners:**+ Serve as a primary point of contact for channel partners, offering guidance and support on Pharos' internal processes, systems, and resources.
+ Foster strong relationships with channel partners to enhance collaboration and maximize their effectiveness in serving customers and driving sales.

**The Ideal Channel Program Manager:*** Unshakable passion and aptitude for continuous learning.
* Proactively inquisitive, enjoys exploring new technologies.
* Independently directed and fearless in asking questions.
* Possesses an "overcome and adapt" mindset.
* Team-centric, adaptable, collaborative, and respectful with a degree of empathy.
* Builds trust while managing and controlling expectations and outcomes.
* Critical thinking and an analytical approach to troubleshooting and problem-solving.
* Ability to work independently as well as with coworkers, customers, and partners.
* Customer service attitude.
* Excellent written, verbal, and listening skills.

**Requirements:*** 1-3 years of experience in channel management, partner relationship management, or a related role within the technology or software industry.
* Proven track record of successfully supporting channel partners in selling products or solutions.
* Experience developing and delivering presentations to channel partners and customers.
* Strong understanding of sales processes and the ability to manage orders and requests from partners effectively.
* Experience in gathering and analyzing feedback from to drive strategic decision-making and product development efforts.
* Familiarity with marketing principles and the ability to collaborate with marketing teams to develop targeted marketing materials and campaigns.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with channel partners.
* Experience working remotely or in a hybrid work environment is a plus.
* Familiarity with CRM (Salesforce) software and other sales enablement tools is preferred.

**Benefits:** This role offers flexible work hours, flexible work location, a base salary, and bonus, along with medical, dental, vision, life & AD&D, short- & long-term disability insurance, and a 401K with a match.  

  

**Join Us!**  

Embrace a challenging and rewarding career at Pharos, where our award-winning print management software and services make print secure, cost-effective, and sustainable. Join a team that serves universities, government agencies, and corporate enterprises worldwide, optimizing their office printing environments.  

As a leader in print management, Pharos makes printing more secure, cost-effective, and user-friendly while reducing its environmental impact for many of the world’s largest global brands. With a forward-thinking mindset, we are committed to providing better print management solutions for the cloud and for our clients with unique needs. As an innovator in print management for over 30 years, Pharos is proud of our history of thinking differently and moving the industry forward with many game-changing technologies.  

  

EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Enterprise Project Manager - Center of Excellence (COE)- Remote
description:
***Sentara Health Plans is currently hiring a Project Manaher- PMO for Center of Excellence (COE)!***

**This is a Full Time position with day shift hours and great benefits!**

**Remote opportunities available in the following states: Alabama, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Indiana, Kansas, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Minnesota, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington (state), West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming!**

**Job Responsibilities:**

* This role is specific to the Center of Excellence for the Enterprise Project Office. The primary focus of this role is to consult and support Business leaders performing the role of a project manager on smaller, less complex initiatives. Responsible for training Business Leaders on how to manage projects. Sometimes called on to manage initiatives listed above as well.

**Required qualifications:**

* 4years related experience in lieu of degree
* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification required within 1 year of hire

**Preferred qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Open to any healthcare experience in clinical/hospital setting but Health Plan/MCO experience is a plus
* Experience in Training, Coaching or Mentoring is a plus

**Diversity and Inclusion at Sentara**

Our vision is that everyone brings the strengths that come with diversity to work with them every day. When we are achieving our vision, we have team members that feel they belong and can be their authentic selves, and our workforce is reflective of the communities we serve.


We are realizing this vision through our Diversity and Inclusion strategy, which has three pillars: A diverse and talented workforce, an inclusive and supportive workplace, and outreach and engagement with our community. We have made remarkable strides in these areas over the past several years and, as our world continues to evolve, we know our work is never done.


Our strategies focus on both *structural inclusion*, which looks at our organizational structures, processes, and practices; as well as *behavioral inclusion*, which evaluates our mindsets, skillsets, and relationships. Together, these strategies are moving our organization forward in an environment that fosters a culture of mutual respect and belonging for all.

**Please visit the link below to learn more about Sentara’s commitment to diversity and inclusion:**


https://www.sentara.com/aboutus/diversity

**Sentara Overview**  

For more than a decade, Modern Healthcare magazine has ranked Sentara Healthcare as one of the nation's top integrated healthcare systems. That's because we are dedicated to growth, innovation, and patient safety at more than 300 sites of care in Virginia and northeastern North Carolina, including 12 acute care hospitals.  

  

**Sentara Benefits**  

As the third-largest employer in Virginia, Sentara Healthcare was named by Forbes Magazine as one of America's best large employers. We offer a variety of amenities to our employees, including, but not limited to:

title: Verification and Validation Program Manager with Federal Consulting Experience
description:
Job Summary

InnoVet Health, a service-disabled veteran owned small business (SDVOSB) and emerging as a highly innovative company that provides health IT and professional services to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), is looking for a seasoned **IV&V Program Manager** with federal consulting background and a minimum of 5 years of experience who can provide direction and project management discipline, and interface with customers ensuring excellent delivery. The ideal candidate will have experience in: Verification and Validation Testing, Compliance, Risk & Remediation (CRR), Agile delivery management and program management skills. The position offers stimulating IV&V projects in a federal sector environment, interacting with senior government staff. It is full-time and does not require relocating (remote position, work from home in the US). The pay, benefits, and growth potential are competitive. Green card or US citizenship required.

Responsibilities

- Responsible for all aspects of the project management on a long-term federal government project performing IV&V Testing for financial management systems. Defines and manages project scope, risks, and objectives.

- Key point of contact for various stakeholders including customer project managers, executives, decision makers, end users, and testing teams. Presents regular program status to customers, leadership and makes recommendations on improving business processes. Responsible for customer satisfaction.

- Develop detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports. Conducts project meetings and is responsible for project tracking, risk management and financial forecasting and analysis. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables.

- Manage the integration of team tasks and tracks and reviews project deliverables and own overall responsibility for projects deliverables.

- Manage team SQA Leads, Scrum Leads and individual resources, provides business, technical and analytical guidance to project team. Recommends and takes action to direct the analysis and solutions of problems. Identify issues/changes, provide solutions, assign tasks, and monitor progress to stay on schedule and on budget.

- Track and manage multiple resources and tasks using Agile methodologies. Develop and maintain project plans including scope, tasks, assignments, timeline, dependencies, and risks in MS Project and Agile tools using JIRA, SmartSheet, MS Planner, etc.

Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience with technical project management using MS Project, Agile for medium and large teams.

- PMP certified is a must, SAFe Agile certification is a plus.

- Federal contracting experience is highly desired.

- Software Testing and SDLC Experience is also highly desired.

- Experience with Compliance, Risk and Remediation (CRR).

- Ability to interface with customers, handle customer issues, manage scope and track project delivery on time. Achieving increased results by leveraging continuous process improvement

- Ability to organize information and present project status and issues to leadership and diverse stakeholders.

- Interpersonal, leadership, problem-solving, multi-tasking, organization skills and flexibility required.

- Excellent collaboration and communication (verbal and writing) skills. Fluent in MS Office tools

- **Green card or US citizen required**. No Visa sponsorship can be supported.

- No 1099 or Corp-to-Corp or international outsourcing or staffing agencies.

Our proven Cybersecurity Subject Matter Experts provide consulting services focused on making an impact for America’s Government and Commercial clients through ensuring Cybersecurity compliance needs are understood and results are trusted.

We are a fast growing team of experienced Cybersecurity and IT professionals making a difference for our nation.

**This Position**

Provides project management leadership and services in support of the goal and objective of the PWS, as required by the COR. Oversees and manages compliance activities of project management teams, daily operations, client/customer relationships, has responsibility for the quality of deliverables, and develops, monitors, and reports on project objectives, budget, and schedule status and performance. The Project Manager is responsible for the technical, contractual, administrative, and financial aspects of the project(s) as assigned by the Federal Task Lead. Responsible for identifying, proposing resolutions, and resolving project management issues in collaboration with applicable federal staff. Familiarity with the federal laws, regulations and circulars listed in subsequent parts of this PWS.

title: Project Manager
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!


*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*

**SUMMARY**

The Project Manager will provide management and oversight of personnel, supervision, scheduling, work assignments, quality control of services and work products, and communications with Government stakeholders. The Project Manager shall have specific mastery level knowledge and experience working with life-cycle support projects for IT procurement.


\\*\\*\\*\\*This position is dependent upon contract award\\*\\*\\*\\*


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.


Provides lifecycle acquisition program/project management support services to include assisting with acquisition strategies, planning, requirements development, market research, proposal evaluation processes, deployment of acquired requirements and closeout. Actions must be well documented, mitigate risk, result in the best business value for the agency and meet all Federal and USDA acquisition regulations and processes.


Provides advice, support, and recommendations for all program/project management matters in the acquisition process to include updating systems, policies, procedures, analyzing issues, developing strategies, and creating standard operating procedures.


Manages the development and delivery of all contract deliverables. This includes supporting and managing the day-to-day operations of other contract personnel.


Provides periodic updates to Government stakeholders.


Develops and maintains an effective quality control program to ensure services are performed in accordance contract documents.


Ensures the successful completion of all contract deliverables and compliance with the quality assurance surveillance plan.


Plans daily activities within the guidelines of company policy, job description and supervisor’s instruction in such a way as to maximize personal output.  



Responsible for aiding in own self-development by being available and receptive to all training made available by the company.  



Responsible for keeping own immediate work area in a neat and orderly condition to ensure safety of self and co-workers. Will report any unsafe conditions and/or practices to the appropriate supervisor and human resources. Will immediately correct any unsafe conditions as the best of own ability.


**COMPETENCIES**

Responsible for the integration of CNI Core Competencies into daily functions, including commitment to integrity, knowledge/quality of work, supporting financial goals of the company, initiative/motivation, cooperation/relationships, problem analysis/discretion, accomplishing goals through organization, positive oral/written communication skills, leadership abilities, commitment to Affirmative Action, reliability/dependability, flexibility, and ownership/accountability of actions taken.


**COMPLIANCE**

Promotes and encourages a culture of compliance with all applicable rules (federal, state, local, Federal Acquisition Regulations, Code of Federal Regulations, Prime Contract requirements, etc.) for themselves and the company as a whole. Fosters an environment in which they will report any violations or reasonably suspected violation of CNI policy, FAR, and/or CFR and are comfortable discussing the myriad compliance, conflict, FAR, CFR, etc. issues that arise during the performance of a government contract.


**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE**

Bachelor's degree and a minimum of fifteen (15) years’ relevant experience, or equivalent combination of education/experience.


**CERTIFICATES/LICENSES/REGISTRATION**

Must be able to pass a customer background check for access to facilities, equipment, and property. This Homeland Security Investigation requires U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident (Green Card) status.


**JOB SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES**

Knowledge of relevant Federal guidelines and regulations include, but are not limited to, OMB Circular No. A-127, Financial Management Systems; OMB Circular No. A-130, Management of Federal Information Resources, paragraph 5 d; the Federal Acquisition Regulation Part 39; NIST SP 800- 161r1, Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management Principles; USDA Departmental Notice (DN) 3540-004, Information and Communication Supply Chain Risk Management; and current cyber security rules for IT contractors.


**LANGUAGE SKILLS**

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret the most complex documents. Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints. Ability to write speeches and articles using original or innovative techniques or style. Ability to make effective and persuasive speeches and presentations on controversial or complex topics to top management, public groups and or boards of directors.


**MATHEMATICAL SKILLS**

Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.


**REASONING ABILITY**

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.


**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job. Work is primarily performed in an office environment. Regularly required to sit. Regularly required use hands to finger, handle, or feel, reach with hands and arms to handle objects, and operate tools, computer, and/or controls. Required to speak and hear. Occasionally required to stand, walk, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Exposed to general office noise with computers printers and light traffic.


**EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT**

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.


* CNI offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* 401(k)
* STD/LTD/AD&D
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Training and Development Opportunities

title: Project Director
description:
**Role:** Project Director (junior to mid-junior level) working at the intersection of Cultural Insights, Innovation, Speculative Futures, Brand Strategy, and Creative Strategy.
  

**Location:** This is a remote position though you must be based in North America.  

Overview


Space Doctors, a Human8 company, is hiring for a position in our North America office. We are a global cultural and creative consultancy and B Corp. We are known for shaping brands and organizations such as Microsoft, Meta, Google, Audi, P&G, J&J, Kraft Heinz, and Phillips (among many others) by helping them connect and respond to cultural change.  

  

We’re looking for a new Project Director to join our team and support us in delivering extraordinary insights and consulting for brands and organizations while helping clients make more environmentally and socially positive decisions.
Key Responsibilities


This role would work at the intersection of cultural insights, innovation, speculative futures, brand strategy, and creative strategy. In this role, you will:* plan and conduct research that addresses our clients’ challenges,
* identify and articulate the insights that our clients will find valuable and inspirational,
* produce reports and presentations delivered to clients with a high standard in terms of their structure, content, conclusions, and provocations,
* assist in managing external analysts, and
* assist in coordinating and communicating with clients.
Preferred Skills & Qualifications


* You will have 2-5 years of experience in a cultural research and insights, brand strategy, or creative strategy environment.
* Degree in semiotics, social science, cultural analysis, brand strategy, marketing, arts, design, or related field.
* Experience in semiotic analysis via social sciences or commercial arts alongside the interest to deepen this skill.
* Excellent written and verbal skills, with strength in being erudite, clear, nuanced, and engaging.
* Some experience with client management is important, as is a proven ability to work across multiple teams and projects.
* Intellectually curious, open, and aware of culture and communications, as well as being able to understand deeper connections, meanings, and dynamics within it. Able to shape and articulate an interesting point of view related to this understanding.
* Passionate about understanding culture to inform imaginative and progressive ways forward.
* An agile thinker and problem solver that is able to flex and improvise as well as frame — and reframe — your thinking.
* Comfortable navigating and working within ambiguity and complexity on projects.
* Proactive, with clarity of purpose.
* Excited to collaborate with an integrated, global team.
* Enthusiastic about working across a variety of categories and client challenges.

**Additional Useful Skills & Qualifications**


* Experience in:
	+ consumer/customer/user insights
	+ trends research and analysis
	+ data analytics platforms for research
	+ go-to-market strategy
* Interest in:
	+ sensory insight approaches
	+ speculative futures
* Additional language skills beyond English, particularly Spanish. As a global consultancy, this helps us stretch our work more effectively, especially in key markets: LATAM, EMEA, and APAC.
What We’re Like


Global, Yet Tight-knit


We have a global team with offices in the UK, Singapore, and North America. Many of us work remote, but we stay close with weekly company calls, and a yearly global gathering in Brighton, UK. We’re a warm group that is built on mutual support, exchange, and respect, with a good dose of humor in the mix.  

Career Growth


We believe that one of the key ways we grow our business is by growing ourselves. We support a non-linear progression through the business which appreciates individual spikes rather than forcing seniority through client or business skills. We value that everyone has a unique “honeycomb” of skills that builds our collective expertise and influence.  

Contribution over Fit


We invite having singular, perceptive, and insightful people that don’t fit any typical moulds, and are able to really contribute to our work by enriching it.  

No Passengers


At Space Doctors, we are deeply passionate about thinking critically about culture, how it’s shifting, understanding what that means for brands and organizations, and working with our clients to embed that understanding in their initiatives. This is not work that comes easily, nor in isolation. With that, everyone works to the fullest of their ability and pitches in to assist others swiftly and thoughtfully. We hope that anyone that joins our team finds their time with us to be challenging, exciting, and hugely rewarding.  

  

**Anticipated Salary Range & Benefits**  

For this particular role, the range is $75,000 - $95,000 a year for full time (depending on experience and skill level). Space Doctors provides an excellent benefits package to our team with generous PTO.  

  

*If you are interested in working with you but would be a better fit in a different role, register your interest at* contact@space-doctors.com.
About Human8


We're Human8, the human-driven consultancy, that connects brands with people and culture to drive positive change.  

  

Human8 is the coming-together of 10 game-changing agencies from around the world: InSites Consulting, Direction First, Columinate, eÿeka, Join the Dots, ABN Impact, Answer Global, Space Doctors, Gongos, and Happy Thinking People.  

  

We unite a creative, smart and ambitious group of +900 people across 23 locations under one vision: making brands more human by better understanding people and culture, empowering brands to take action, and enhancing the lives of the people they serve.
  
**Application Deadline**


March 29, 2024


**Department**


Client Delivery


**Employment Type**


Permanent - Full Time


**Location**


Global (Remote)


**Workplace type**


Fully remote


**Compensation**


$75,000 - $95,000 / year


**Reporting To**


Tamara Connolly

title: Salesforce Project Manager
description:
**Demand Chain has built a company and culture that improves the lives of our team, clients, and the communities around us. We work hard to ensure our teammates feel engaged, motivated, challenged, with a sense of belonging, so they can thrive.****Defining traits of our culture include: passion, a sense of urgency, integrity, accountability, adaptability, ownership, joy, and optimism. We’re problem solvers, life-long learners, experts in our industry, slightly sarcastic, but always fun-loving.****Sound like you? Want to grow, develop, build meaningful relationships, and create value for the communities around us?****JOIN OUR TEAM!****About the role**

* **Our Project Managers are responsible for planning, leading, organizing, and motivating agile project teams to achieve a high level of performance and quality in delivering agile projects that provide exceptional business value to our clients.**
	+ **At a team level: playing a consultative role to help put in place the appropriate people, process, and tools as needed to optimize the efficiency of the project team**
	+ **In situations that require a hybrid Agile approach: using good judgment and skill to develop a project management approach that is suitable for planning and managing the effort to achieve the project goals within designated project constraints**
* **What you’ll be doing:**
	+ **Project Planning and Management – Define project scope and schedule while focusing on regular and timely delivery of value; organize and lead project status and working meetings; prepare and distribute progress reports; manage risks and issues; correct deviations from plans; and perform delivery planning for assigned projects**
	+ **Team Management – Assist in team development while holding teams accountable for their commitments, removing roadblocks to their work; leveraging organizational resources to improve capacity for project work; and mentoring and developing team members**
	+ **Business Analyst Support – Support the BA in managing customer expectations for project deliverables, managing stakeholder communications, and helping to implement an effective system of project governance**
	+ **Process Management and Improvement – Define and manage a well-defined project management process and champion ongoing process improvement initiatives to implement best practices for Agile Project Management**
	+ **Team building – promote empowerment of the team, ensure that each teammate is fully engaged in the project and making a meaningful contribution, and encourage a sustainable pace with high-levels of quality for the team**
* **Qualifications:**
	+ **Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as strong knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment**
	+ **Salesforce Certified, with experience leading Salesforce projects in the PM capacity**
	+ **A proven track record of successfully implementing software or web development projects using Agile methodologies including 5+ years of experience as a Project Manager in a high-tech development environment with multi-function teams.**
	+ **Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent preferred**
	+ **Experience overseeing multi-function project teams with at least 5 - 10 teammates including Developers, Business Analysts, and QA Personnel**
		- **Sufficient level of technical background to provide highly-credible leadership to development teams and to be able to accurately and objectively evaluate complex project risks and issues**
* **Skills Required:**
	+ **BA or BS or equivalent experience is required**
	+ **3-5+ years managing IT projects dealing with Software Development (SDLC)**
	+ **Experience in Salesforce (SFDC) CRM with end-to-end implementation experience**
	+ **Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands**
	+ **Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs with the ability to establish/maintain high level of customer trust and confidence**
	+ **Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives, goals, and commitments are met**
	+ **Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level**
	+ **Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view**

title: Program Manager Industry Trends
description:
Our team is seeking an experienced information technology Program Manager to run a client Industry and trend analysis / insight function. You are successfully responsible for planning, organizing, and overseeing the successful completion of the initial scope listed below. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and resources to ensure program goals and objectives are achieved on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards.

**Initial scope**

5.5.1 INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY TRENDS AND INSIGHTS MONITORING AND REPORTING

The program manager shall coordinate expert analysis, monitoring, and reporting on relevant industry standards and best practices. The program manager shall review and coordinate actions on congressional guidance, executive orders, and federal mandates to ensure client has the knowledge and awareness required to guide the strategic coordination and alignment activities impacting Enterprise IT Strategic Planning. The Contractor shall use proven industry tools and methods to perform expert analysis summarized monthly and shall develop written Information Technology Trends and Insights Monitoring Reports. Report topics will be determined based on monthly analysis or emerging topics of interest to client leadership. The reports shall be in the form of whitepapers and briefings on information technology trends and capabilities highlighting the relevance or risk to client’s mission, capabilities, in-flight initiatives, and service offerings.

5.5.2 LESSONS LEARNED REVIEWS AND REPORTS

The Contractor shall facilitate quarterly lessons learned reviews with OSC with a focus on continuous improvement, documentation, communication, and application of lessons learned. The Contractor shall document recommendations to improve the overall effectiveness of OSC’s strategic planning processes and work products in the Lessons Learned Reports.

**Skills you will need:**

* Ability to stay organized with strong attention to details
* Project plan development experience – Ability to map structure processes to a defined plan, communicate direction, and work together as a team to meet objectives.
* Strong documentation skills to capture the key details of each working session, extract action items and deliverables, maintain tracking of all action items and deliverables, and ensure they are completed on time in a cross-functional team.
* Comfortable with follow-ups, gently but firmly pushing back, and holding team members accountable to ensure deliverables are met.
* Proactively identify risks and opportunities.
* Proficient in using Microsoft Word, Visio, Excel, and PowerPoint

**Qualifications/Requirements**

* PMP
* Minimum of 10 years of applicable experience
* Must be able to pass a Federal Government background check.
* Must be available during normal business hours.
* Must be a US Citizen or Green card holder. VE does not provide Sponsorship.

title: Project Manager - Medical, Manufacturing, Life Sciences - Remote, USA
description:
**The Role**  

If you want to discover your greatest potential, Saint-Gobain provides one-of-a-kind opportunities for innovative problem solvers.



We're one of only two companies in the world that is consistently recognized as both a top Global Employer and a Top 100 Global Innovator, but Saint-Gobain's remarkable story and culture of innovation begins with a team of nearly 200,000 creative, diverse and passionate team members collaborating across the globe. We are committed to our mission to improve lives because, every day, we witness the enormous impact of our efforts on the world around us.


**The Project Manager will lead business-wide strategic projects enabling the global growth of Saint-Gobain Life Sciences' Medical, Electronic Components & Catheter businesses while supporting capacity expansions, technical transfers, industrialization and commercial process optimization. Will also support new business projects from commercialization to industrialization.**


**The Project Manager maintains a culture of accountability achieving worldwide excellence in the delivery of products/technology/services in support of existing and / or new business projects. Works across departments and functions to ensure flow of communication and transparency of information. Drives and innovates continuous improvements to the system, partnering with Business Development, Customer Success, Marketing, Supply Chain, QA, RA, Purchasing, IT, Operations and Site Leadership Teams to ensure all facets of Commercial and Operations are considered throughout the project life cycle.**



In a highly agile and empowered environment, will manage key projects while also ensuring the success of other projects across the organization, mentoring and coaching site level Project Leads.


**Key Accountabilities:**



Provides project direction, metric definition, and performance management. This role provides a single point of accountability for all aspects of assigned projects and the project management system used in the MEC Business Units.



Train others in best practice project management. Support, guide and coach other project managers to be successful in leading their assigned projects.



Proactively lead & organize pre-project phases to define the case for project justification/support.



Leverage global project management standards & expertise for the Business Units, with alignment with departmental standards for Engineering, R&D, etc.



Seek, adjust and integrate modern Project Management approaches like scrum or other agile approaches, methods and principles to support our project management needs in the fast changing VUCA (Volatility, Uncertainty, Complexity and Ambiguity) environment. Also, utilize the available Saint-Gobain internal available PM systems e.g. EEM (Early Equipment Management).

 **Requirements** **Education:**



Bachelor's Degree - within Engineering, Business, Organizational Development, Project Management or related field of study; Required.



Master's Degree - Degree in Industrial or Process Engineering (Mechanical, building construction & execution, or similar field and / or Complex Project Management, or Organizational Development & change management; Preferred.



Certificate of Completion within Project Management, Required.



Certificate of Completion in Change management, Project Team Building or Leadership Training; Required.


**Experience:**

7+ years of Project Management experience, using standard project management approaches while managing complex projects involving matrixed or multi-business environments and cross-functional teams; Required.



3+ years of Project Management experience within Operations; Required.



Experience with modern agile approaches, continuous improvement projects / Kaizens (CIP); Preferred.



Experience in regulated industry (i.e. FDA, ISO, etc.) and working in controlled cleanroom environments; Preferred.



WCM/Lean/Six Sigma experience/certification; Preferred.



Ability to travel at 20%, domestic; Required.

 **Additional Requirements**  

Certain states require pay information be provided in job postings. Saint-Gobain aims to deliver a comprehensive Total Rewards package to support our employees’ wellbeing and help improve daily life for themselves and their families. We believe in the importance of pay transparency in what we offer prospective candidates and provide the national pay range for this position which is **$99,900to $154,800** per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors.



In addition to base salary, this position is eligible for an annual bonus. The targeted bonus amount is **13%** of base salary based on company and individual performance measures. The Total Target Cash range (base pay and annual bonus) for this position, is **$112,887 to $174,924.** Bonus payments are part of variable compensation and by nature can vary based on company and individual performance and is not a guarantee.


**Employees have the flexibility to choose the benefits that best fit their individual needs.**


* Health and Wellbeing – Supporting your wellbeing, to thrive in life and work.
	+ Medical, Prescription Drug, Vision, and Dental Insurance
	+ Healthcare Saving Account and Flexible Spending Account options
	+ LiveWell Wellness Program
	+ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
	+ Paid Time Off and Paid Parental Leave
* Retirement and Protection - Helping to make the future life you want a reality.
	+ 401(k) with Company Match, Retirement Accumulation Plan (RAP), Cash Balance Pension Plan
	+ Company-provided Life Insurance, AD&D, Short-Term Disability
	+ Voluntary employee and dependent life insurance, Long-Term Disability, Critical Illness and Accident Insurance
* Additional Benefits – Helping shape the experience and impact you want
	+ Commuter Benefits
	+ Group Legal
	+ Identity Theft Protection
	+ Auto and Home Insurance
	+ Pet Insurance and Discounts
	+ Back-up Child & Elder Care
	+ PerkSpot Employee Discount Program

  




  

**About Us**  

Saint-Gobain’s innovations touch almost every major industry around the world. Within its Life Sciences division, teams are solving critical problems for customers who are getting life-saving medical devices to the frontlines of healthcare, discovering essential medications, and nourishing and connecting the world through consumer, industrial and electronics applications. As one of the world’s leading producers of high-performance polymer products, we improve lives by making simple experiences better and being there in life’s critical moments.



Our team members recognize that we all create the environment for people to succeed, with a culture built on respect, open and honest communication, and honoring our commitments to our customers and each other. And at the heart of our culture, we’ve learned working together makes good ideas, great ones.



With a legacy dating back more than 350 years, Saint-Gobain offers employees the stability and security of a leading Global 500 corporation while operating like multiple small and agile start-ups, where entrepreneurial spirit, pioneering teamwork, and bold, forward-thinking ideas pave new paths.



Every team member is encouraged to develop and leverage their unique expertise and strengths to make the greatest impact on the company and our end users. At Saint-Gobain, you’re empowered and equipped with countless opportunities and resources for professional development. You will find the support you need to create a vision and roadmap for your career, and make that vision a reality.


**Join Us at Saint-Gobain Life Sciences. Together, we’ll create a better life.**



Click here to Explore more opportunities within Saint-Gobain Life Sciences.
