Saint-Gobain is an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and supports the hiring of veterans.

  

Job Reference: USA08265

title: Oracle Strategic Accounts - Project Manager
description:
**Location:** **Remote**
------------------------

**Type:** **Full Time**
-----------------------

**Min. Experience:** **Manager/Supervisor**
-------------------------------------------


  
This role is directly responsible for managing Strategic Accounts Projects, the performance of project delivery teams, and ensuring projects and client engagements run smoothly. The Strategic Program/Project Manager supervises services as agreed by the client and Centroid in the contract, ensures deliverables are met, and is responsible for maintaining customer satisfaction at the project level with an emphasis on growing business within the account.

**Location: Remote**

**Job Type: Full Time**

**Requirements:**

* Develop and maintain project deliverables; including and not limited to; milestone dates, project plans, statuses, allocation of resources, project dependencies and budgets.
* Coordination of technical resources, as well as, facilitating the communication with clients, partners, and vendors.
* Ability to guide teams through the planning, design, development, testing, training and implementation stages of varying technical projects.
* Ability to define and manage to the scope of work, purpose, assumptions, and problem statement with the customer and project resources.
* Track, manage, negotiate, and maintain client SOWs (Statements of Work), budgets, and project resource timesheets.
* Provide reports to an agreed schedule (or on request), including RAID Logging (Risks, Actions, Issues, Decisions) plus overall project status updates (e.g. Red, Yellow, Green summary status).
* Ability to communicate and create potential needs for change orders with clients based upon modifications in scope or when issues are identified that impact timelines and/or budgets.
* Establish and maintain strong client relationships to establish Centroid as a trusted advisor and supporter of the customer's business goals.
* Attend or facilitate client Project Review and Client Review meetings; areas covered will include performance reports, quality process and project performance.
* Transition clients to Centroid’s Managed Services Offering
* Communicate with clients to understand their needs and explain Centroid’s value.
* Collaborating with internal departments to facilitate client need fulfillment.
* Responsible for maintaining internal monthly billing in accordance with client contracts or statement of work. This includes regular reviews and management of resources time and timesheets.
* Maintain knowledge of the latest industry technologies and Centroid Service Offerings.

**Required Skills:**

* Demonstrable experience working in a Professional Service Management capacity on large-sized projects in the technical industry.
* Consulting experience managing resources, and clients.
* Experience developing and managing technical projects.
* Proven people management skills.
* Proven ability to manage large projects and grow the book of business within the client account.
* Must possess strong written and oral communication skills.
* 5-10 years of applicable industry experience supporting large engagements

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience managing projects utilizing Oracle technology - strongly preferred.
* Expertise in Oracle application solutions, cloud consulting, integration, and managed services – strongly preferred.

**Education:**

* Bachelors Preferred

title: Global Program Manager - Early Career
description:
Greif offers a great working environment and the opportunity to make an immediate impact at a company where your ideas are always welcome.
Job Requisition #:
026678 Global Program Manager - Early Career (Open)
Job Description:
Summary
At Greif, we believe developing talent is critical to our long-term success. We are hiring a Global Program Manager, Early Careers to expand our Early Career recruiting strategy & program globally. This role is responsible for building relationships & partnerships, increasing employer branding and awareness, and identifying & attracting top talent from universities, local colleges and technical program institutions. Early Careers at Greif includes not only professional Interns & Cop-Ops, but also high demand skilled technical & manufacturing Interns & Apprentices. The Global Program Manager will be responsible for the continual evolution of our professional program, as well as for the design & implementation of a global program for skilled manufacturing talent. You will coordinate and manage all aspects of the recruitment process, including event planning, logistics, and related program activities & events. You will manage a small team of regional Early Career Talent Specialists, and partner with and present to key business leaders & stakeholders to drive expansion of a global Early Career recruitment program.
As a valued member of the Talent Attraction team, the Global Program Manager, Early Careers collaborates closely with hiring managers, academic institutions, and other stakeholders to develop effective recruitment strategies and build strong relationships with prospective candidates. You will develop & present regular updates and reports to hiring managers and senior leadership on recruitment activities, progress, and challenges. Additionally, you will track and analyze recruitment metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of our recruitment strategies and make data-driven recommendations for improvement. In this role you will utilize your extensive experience in University Relations and Early Career talent recruiting, strong knowledge of creative sourcing strategies and full lifecycle recruiting best practices to lead and manage your team.
This position can be hybrid or fully remote, based in the eastern US, and reports to the Director, Global Talent Attraction.  


Principle Duties and Responsibilities* Partner with regional business leaders and HR teams to assess Voice of the Customer and business needs to ensure program alignment with organizational priorities
* Serve as subject matter expert on strategy, development, and execution of all programs for early career talent; socialize & present to key senior leaders and stakeholders to gain buy-in, including required investments
* Develop an agile and scalable global program and team to adapt to changing business priorities and program maturity
* Leverage existing Early Careers recruitment practices to develop a global end to end program for Co-Ops, Apprenticeships, Interns and recent Graduates
* Oversee full-cycle recruitment process for Early Careers talent
* Work with internal teams to develop communications and engagements to increase program & employer brand recognition
* Develop & foster relationships with students, student organizations, faculty, and Career Services at target campuses to provide best in class engagement
* Develop & conduct training and educational sessions for participating Hiring Managers, key stakeholders, and program participants
* Measure and assess program effectiveness; generate reports and create data driven insights that represent the growth & success of early career programs
* Plan, execute, and participate in campus recruiting activities such as campus presentations, career fairs, coffee chats, networking events, job platforms, and social media campaigns.
* Plan and implement Early Careers on-boarding and post hire engagement activities, events and group activities such as Intern Summit, newsletters, surveys, etc.
* Partner with Global Talent Center colleagues to create learning plans to support development needs of our Early Career talent
* Develop a high performing team to support Early Careers recruiting globally.


Education & Experience* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum 8 years’ experience in recruitment or related talent programs to include at least 3 years directly supporting Early Careers Co-Op & Intern talent
* Minimum 3 years leadership experience either directly managing a recruiting team, leading recruiting operations or in a program management role
* Demonstrated experience designing, implementing, and running Talent programs across multiple businesses or geographic locations


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities* Proven stakeholder management expertise and an ability to liaise & influence various levels of management, including engaging with senior leaders across organizational departments and geographical cultures
* Experience building new talent programs from the ground up, inclusive of stakeholder buy in and investment garnering
* High-level of critical thinking and strategic mindset required; can adapt and pivot, as necessary
* Excellent organizational, data analysis, project management skills
* Learning agility, ability to work in ambiguity, and the ability to work in fast-paced environment with competing priorities
* Understanding of regional talent markets complexities and compliance
* Highly skilled in creating & delivering compelling data driven presentations
* Proven track record attracting & engaging Early Career talent in highly competitive markets
* Continuous improvement mindset, recommending new approaches to current processes and procedures
* Strong knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems, HRIS tools, associated job boards and candidate platforms
* Ability to travel up to 25% as needed and attend both virtual and in-person recruitment events

title: Jr. Project Manager
description:
**Location: Remote – Somerville, MA**


**Opportunity**



The Project Manager owns the delivery of projects for Heila’s clients, including managing relationships with project developers, installers, operators, and others.


The Project Manager oversees all aspects of a project setting schedules, assigning responsibilities, managing subcontracts, monitoring status, reporting on progress, and preparing the necessary deliverables for commercial operation and financial close.


**Specific Responsibilities**


* Manage project personnel, subcontractors, project scope, budget, schedule, deliverables, and financial analysis.
* Directly interact with Heila’s customers and partners, managing customer service, relationships, and contracts.
* Manage and update schedules to reflect current information, monitor critical path activities, and track outstanding items.
* Work closely with the Sales, Finance, Product, and Engineering Teams to satisfy all requirements for commercial operation and financial close.
* Manage the scalation of technical questions to the appropriate subject matter experts.
* Evaluate technologies and equipment, providing recommendations as needed.
* Create project reports and documentation needed for commercial operation and financial close.
* Provide technical assistance, support, and collaboration.
* Responsible for project cash-flow management: progress billing, collections support and monitoring, and resource management
* Ensure compliance with company, industry, trade, and jurisdictional safety standards, practices, and codes.
* Foster positive and effective business relationships at all levels and project phases.


**Skills/Requirements**


* 2-3 years of project management work experience focusing on complex DER projects in an industrial/engineering environment, with people management responsibilities.
* Excellent knowledge and understanding of mechanical and electrical engineering.
* Proven experience with OSHA safety standards, mechanical and electrical systems development, engineering, and project management regulations, practices, and codes.
* Strong IT skills – Microsoft Office, Atlassian JIRA/Confluence, MS Project and AutoCAD.
* Bachelors in EE, ME or Construction Management.
* Ability to travel as needed.
* Must possess a keen analytical mind, be strong on planning, detail, and accuracy, and have a deep understanding of project management expertise. Must possess substantial skills in written and oral communication with all levels of management and with outside contacts.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Good understanding of control and optimization systems used in DER projects.
* Knowledge of DER equipment and applications – including solar arrays, batteries, generators, fuel cells, among others.
* Knowledge and understanding of resilience and economic use cases in DER projects.
* Understanding of utility grid interconnection processes and rules.
* Master’s degree in engineering or project management.


#LI-Remote  

#LI-SC2


***Applicants must be authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future.***


*The salary range for this position is $87,450 – $111,100. The specific salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including the candidate’s experience, their education, and the work location. Available benefits include medical, dental, vision & 401k.*

title: Project Manager, Spectra Managed Services (Pittsburgh, PA)
description:
**What is special about Lighthouse?**


Lighthouse is built on a foundation of unique, compassionate, highly driven individuals. We elevate the strengths and talents of those around us while leveraging opportunities for growth. We offer the experience of solving complex problems while continuing to grow multiple facets of your career. Lighthouse is where innovation meets support and where collaboration is the key ingredient to success. We grow together and are stronger together.

 **What’s unique about this role?**

* Support development and implementation of internal data retention / e-discovery policies and best practices.
* Support e-discovery and legal technology applications for legal and compliance teams globally with a focus on litigation and investigations.
* Provide expertise and insight on the most efficient management of preservation, collection, review and analysis of electronic documents and data from company sources, and supervision of same.
* Support existing legal management tools and technologies, as well as review and provide recommendations on new and/or updated technology, and manage implementation of new tools and training.
* Support analysis of data to drive positive outcomes and efficiencies for external spend.
* Support Global Legal and Compliance teams on key projects and initiatives as directed by management.
* Develop and implement internal data retention / e-discovery policies and best practices working closely with other internal stakeholders in IT, Information Security, Compliance, Legal, outside counsel, vendors and others.

 **What will this person do?**

* Develop and implement internal data retention / e-discovery policies and best practices working closely with other internal stakeholders in IT, Information Security, Compliance, Legal, outside counsel, vendors and others.
* Responsible for handling all facets of the e-discovery life cycle, including implementing document/data retention policies, identification of relevant custodians, placement of legal holds, engaging and coordinating among all stakeholders (e.g., internal/external counsel, business units, IT, custodians, external vendors), identification of relevant data sets/sources, collection of data from employees and third parties, performing complex searches, applying filtering and culling techniques, creating workspaces and workflows appropriate for data sets, document review and assisting with preparation of productions and documents.
* Preparation of legal documentation associated with discovery, such as privilege logs, discovery responses, ESI Orders/Stipulations/Agreements, chains of custody and affidavits/verifications.
* Manage standard ESI protocols, including reviewing and updating protocols, training materials and workflows.
* Support internal and external counsel with negotiating ESI protocols and appropriately tailored search terms.
* Responsible for ensuring consistent approach to document production, discovery responses and application of privileges/protections across matters globally.
* Support adherence to and continued learning regarding e-discovery best practices and standards.
* Maintain subject matter expertise on legal and regulatory obligations relating to records management.
* Support internal and external counsel in obtaining, evaluating and negotiating services from third-party e-discovery vendors, including identifying, vetting, supervising and/or conducting quality control.
* Prepare and/or review e-discovery budgets and ensure projects remain within established costs and time parameters.
* Provide support and make recommendations relating to legal technology tools/software (such as e-billing, case and document management platforms, Microsoft e-discovery programs, legal hold platform and applicable AI tools), including assistance with evaluating, recommending, and updating software/programs as needed, designing/implementing to meet internal needs, and training users.
* Gather, organize and evaluate data from e-billing and matter management platforms to identify trends and insights. Leverage to develop actionable steps for improving ways of working and developing greater efficiencies relating to external spend.
* Support efforts to identify, retain and obtain documents/information in all forms for use in litigation/investigations, including those outside the scope of e-discovery.
* Perform other duties as requested.
* Support the Global Legal and Compliance Teams in providing support on strategy, key projects and initiatives as directed by management.

 **Bring your passion and together we will shine. It would also be great if you have the following:**

* Minimum of 3 to 5 years of law firm, in-house legal department and/or consulting firm / e-discovery provider experience
* Demonstrated thorough knowledge of e-discovery and litigation lifecycle
* Technical and working knowledge of M365 e-discovery solutions and data sources, including Purview.
* Ability to perform e-discovery related tasks with little to no IT support
* Demonstrated experience performing variety of e-discovery tasks, including data preservation/collection/retention, development of complex search parameters based on understanding of relevant issues, and document review workflow and production
* Knowledge, experience, and confidence to provide technical insight and recommendations to internal and external counsel
* Strong aptitude for technology
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
* Willingness to continue learning and keeping pace with developments in the legal technology / AI space
* Understanding of privilege and work product protections, as well as laws governing confidentiality of health, financial and other data
* Pragmatic problem solver with strong analytical skills
* Strong communication and presentation skills to communicate with people at various levels across organizations
* Strong leader with empathy and ability to build relationships with people at various levels
* Able to work autonomously within the role and operate at a professional level
* Ability to work collaboratively with others, both within and outside of Legal team
* Strong time management skills coupled with an ability to manage both internal and external stakeholders
* A keen interest in and ability to understand the business, its strategies, its people and its organizational structures
* Preference for candidates with:
	+ J.D. degree
	+ Data privacy and data security experience/training
	+ Global experience
	+ Fluency or proficiency in foreign languages
	+ Technical and working knowledge of e-discovery and legal technology platforms, such as Relativity, Brainspace, Nuix
	+ Familiarity with TyMetrix and iManage
	+ Familiarity with electronic legal research databases such as Westlaw and Lexis Nexis
* Familiarity with US Federal and state court e-discovery rules/protocols

**Work Environment and Physical Demands**

* Duties are performed in a typical office environment while at a desk or computer table.
* Duties require the ability to use a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material, in a quiet and professional setting.
* Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends).

  

Lighthouse celebrates and thrives on diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire, train, and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. We welcome any talents and contributions you can bring to the team and are deeply committed to growing an environment where everyone can feel safe, is respected, and can show up as themselves. Come as you are!


As required by applicable pay transparency laws, Lighthouse complies with compensation disclosure requirements for roles that may be hired in locations under these requirements. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include a wide array of factors, including: your specific skills and experience, geographic location, or other relevant factors. The salary range for this position may be tailored to be lower or higher in different talent markets.


The expected pay for this role will range from $86,620 to $115,500 per year. This role will be eligible to participate in an annual bonus or incentive program.


Lighthouse offers a quality comprehensive benefits package including, medical, dental, vision, and a 401k with company match. Company paid benefits also include Life & AD&D, short and long-term disability, telemedicine through 98point6, and other wellness plans. We offer a generous Flexible PTO program and paid volunteer days. Employees may also participate in voluntary insurance plans including accident, hospitalization, and critical illness plans as well as pet insurance.


 As a trailblazer and catalyst for change, Lighthouse rises to each opportunity to help our clients and our people do what they do best—shine.

title: Technical Project Manager - Construction / Nuclear
description:
**JD- Technical Project Manager**

**Location : Los Alamos, New Mexico (REMOTE)** 

**(U.S Citizens only)**

**Job Description:**

Description:

* TPM2 The technical project manager manages and ensures the timely completion of discrete technical or operational projects; establishes technical requirements for the project; defines project deliverables, budgets, schedules, and risks; and oversees the project team in the planning, tracking, and execution of the project from initiation to completion.
* Projects are a set of related activities needed to produce specific products or services to meet customer’s requirements.
* Projects develop work packages that define what will be accomplished to meet specific programmatic needs and produce the work products defined by the work packages.
* Assumes responsibility for day-to-day administrative/operational management of all activities and functions in a designated program area within a line or staff department, including contributing to the development, implementation and evaluation of program policies, procedures and standards; determining program service levels and enhancements; assists with the development of and monitoring program budgets; providing technical advice to staff, other departments, and performs related work as required.
* Prefer prior DOE experience supporting construction projects, direct involvement in Risk Management, and using EVMS programs.

title: Project Manager, Client Service - Western US
description:
### **Job Title**


Project Manager, Client Service - Western US### **Job Description**


As the Client Service Project Manager, you will be a member of the IntelliSpace Project Management team, within the Healthcare Information Technology (HIT) business unit, which provides affordable and integrated informatics solutions for health systems. By enabling intelligent decision-making and improving clinical pathways, we will lead to better clinical, operational, and financial outcomes across the health continuum.

**Your role:**

* Creating and communicating statement of work and project plans, while coordinating with customer project managers and other Philips project managers on cross modality projects.
* Clearly and effectively communicating to and receiving information from different departments, external customers, field partners and other areas of the business.
* Documenting and distributing information appropriately to facilitate project flow and appropriately escalating any project concerns to appropriate personnel.
* Maintaining excellent customer service skills through ongoing training and development, while acting as a Philips Representative in response to customer inquiries and communicates information.
* Functioning as an active member of the team and providing leadership and guidance to junior team members, by sharing knowledge and experience to resolve customer issues.
* Personally, owning the customer experience as a resource to the goals of the team, taking ownership and works with manager on development planning.
* Providing a positive, cohesive company image when discussing the company, products, and management decisions, etc., with customers and field partners.
* The ability to travel domestically up to 30%, via car and air is an essential function of this role.

**You're the right fit if:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field
* Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Project Manager implementing Cardiology, Radiology or Healthcare Informatics software
* PMP or ITIL Certification (required)
* Knowledge of network topology; network security (Firewalls, VPN, etc.)
* Knowledge in DICOM configuration/conformance and PACS servers and client server configuration
* Working knowledge of MS Office/Windows (XP, 7, Server 2008 & 2012) and CRM applications
* High performing team mentality, with ability to establish and maintain effective relationships
* Strong communication with the ability to lead, organize, present and conduct customer project reviews
* Capacity to handle multiple simultaneous demands and prioritizes work with minimal supervision
* MCSA or MCITP (MS Certified IT Professional) in Windows Server 2008 (preferred)
* Knowledge of virtualization, hardware scalability and availability (preferred)
* US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company ***will not*** consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.
* Company relocation benefits ***will not*** be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in the Western United States or be able to support Pacific Time.
* You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this position.

**About Philips**


We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.
* Read more about our employee benefits.


If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

**Philips Transparency Details**

The pay range for this position is $74,750 to $138,000, annually. The actual base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors including job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity.


In addition, other compensation, such as an annual incentive bonus, sales commission or long-term incentives may be offered. Employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive Philips Total Rewards benefits program, which includes a generous PTO, 401k (up to 7% match), HSA (with company contribution), stock purchase plan, education reimbursement and much more. Details about our benefits can be found here.


At Philips, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top end of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each case.


*Philips is an* *Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran and maintains a drug-free workplace.*

title: Upgrade Project Manager
description:
Are you a current Elekta employee?
Please click here to apply through our internal career site Find Jobs - Elekta.
Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?
We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.
We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!
Project Managers are responsible for the development, coordination and completion of assigned software implementations/projects. The Project Manager is the primary point of contact for the client when planning and implementing Elekta software solutions. The goal is to work towards and ensure a timely, quality and under budget implementation.
The selected candidate will be responsible for building client relationships and maintaining client satisfaction during and after the implementation. The Project Manager will work closely with other Elekta team members to schedule resources to complete the required task(s). The success of the Project Manager relies strongly on his/her ability to communicate, set and maintain clear expectations with everyone involved in the implementation.
Preferred location: Atlanta, GA
Candidates may also reside anywhere in the US close to a major airport.
Responsibilities:* Support and further customer implementations of their assigned Elekta products as per established procedures, as well as document and communicate the status of such implementations and constantly seek ways to improve processes and documentation.
* Oversee and take charge of customer implementations by providing guidance and support to customers as necessary with the aim of effecting a timely and successful implementation of devices and software and providing a single point contact to the customer.
* The project manager is responsible for the revenue of each project.
* Exercise his/her influence with the customer to drive the project, without sacrificing the quality of the implementation.
* Maintain awareness of all preorders within his/her territory and communicate those opportunities to the manager of Project Management on a weekly basis.
* Maintain the central documentation database to manage and communicate progress on pending implementations.
* Maintain CLM and ERP with individual site details.
* Communicate the status of implementations to Site Coordinator, Order Administration, Installation and Application teams.
* Also establish/maintain communication with Sales for leads and opportunities.
* Analyze upcoming installations in terms of product mix and revenue to help prioritize scheduling.
* Implement modifications to process/documentation to increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction.
* Review and contribute to product-specific engineering documentation.
* Generate, edit, maintain product-specific documentation and distribute as part of implementation and process (e.g., Checklists, feature notes, technical references, interface specifications, help files, etc.)
* Generate or assist in the generation of proposals which outline ELEKTA’s standard implementation process or propose alternative solutions to meet customer requirements.
* Update ERP and CLM systems with the project planning data to allow forecasting of revenue.


Qualifications:* Minimum of 4-5 years of experience managing software implementation projects and or medical equipment projects.
* Minimum BS or BA Degree or equivalent experience.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to manage multiple projects at any given time.
* Assertive character to guide the customer according to the company targets rather then being guided by the customer.
* Ability to effectively interact with customers (via phone and in person.)
* Ability to effectively interact with members of other departments.
* Demonstrated initiative in mastering core and specialty product assignments.
* Familiarity/proficiency with the following: Outlook, Word, Excel, MS Project and Windows Based Applications.
* Tenacity and the ability to effectively use available resources to assess and resolve problems.
* Ability to travel 40% of the time.
* Demonstrated ability to accomplish objectives with and through others without direct control.


EEO Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Top Secret Cleared - IT Project Manager - Senior
description:
True Zero Technologies, a veteran-owned small business, was founded on the principle that the purposeful enablement of people and technology in an organization directly ties to the quality of its outcomes. True Zero recognizes that said outcomes begin and end with our people, and that is what we have built, a community of like-minded, driven, and passionate individuals and innovators who are aligned in a common goal of delivering top tier services to our customers. In 2023, True Zero was recognized as a “Best Places to Work” in two categories ("Prosperous and Thriving" ($5MM – $50MM in gross revenue) and "Mid-Atlantic Region" (DC, DE, MD, NC, VA, WV)) and in 2022, was recognized as one of Inc. Magazine’s Top 5000 Fastest Growing Companies.  

  

We are seeking an experienced IT Project Manager with an active Top Secret security clearance to join our team. As a Senior IT Project Manager at True Zero, you will lead and oversee large-scale IT implementation projects for our clients. You will be responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of projects on time, within scope, and within budget.
### **Responsibilities**

* Manage and lead large-scale IT implementation projects from initiation to closure.
* Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with clients.
* Develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and budgets.
* Coordinate and communicate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Monitor project progress and deliverables, and ensure adherence to timelines and quality standards.
* Identify and mitigate project risks and issues.
* Prepare and present project status reports to clients and senior management.

### **Qualifications**

* Active Top Secret security clearance
* Bachelor's degree in Project Management, Business, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Minimum of 7 years of experience as a Project Manager, with a focus on large-scale IT implementations.
* Proven track record of successfully delivering complex IT projects on time and within budget.
* Strong project management and leadership skills.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
* Project management certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) preferred.


We’re actively searching for talented security and technology practitioners who are ready to experience the True Zero difference. As a True Zero team member, you'll enjoy:* Competitive salary, paid twice per month
* Best in class medical coverage
* 100% of medical premiums covered by True Zero
* Company wide new business incentive programs
* Contribution Incentives (i.e. white papers, blog posts, internal webinars, etc.)
* 3 weeks of PTO starting + 11 Paid Holidays Annually
* 401k Program with 100% company match on the first 4%
* Monthly reimbursement of Cell Phone and Home Internet costs
* Paternity/Maternity Leave
* Investment in training and certifications to broaden and deepen your technical skills

title: Program Manager, Digital IT
description:

### **Description & Requirements**

**About the Role**


As the Program Manager, Digital IT, you will be leading a diverse portfolio of large global complex cross-functional technology-centric projects. You will also oversee all project work being performed by the team and work with divisional stakeholders to ensure the alignment of requirements and commitment to deliverables, understand challenges, and coordinate activities.

 **What You Will Do**

* Simultaneously manage multiple global cross-functional complex technology-centric projects.
* Lead initiatives in the Digital IT team and be the liaison between business, development/ implementation teams, and stakeholders. The individual will demonstrate leadership and flexibility, as well as the ability to build rapport with teams to understand and deliver desired outcomes.
* Interface with all levels of management and staff to provide strategic and tactical advice on project planning and execution and keep management informed.
* Adhere to Solution Delivery Lifecycle Methodology and PMO procedures. Assembles project team, identifies needed resources, assigns responsibilities, and develops timeframes to facilitate successful completion of project activities and deliverables. Build and manage the end-to-end project plan, and monitor/report progress. Effectively manage scope and dependencies. Identify risks and issues and proactively resolve/mitigate them. Ensure that the project is delivered on time, cost, and quality.
* Ensure that business outcomes are defined, approved, and delivered. Proficient with benefits realization, and ensuring that benefits are delivered in the best way possible

**What You Need**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business administration or related field, or equivalent work experience.
* Ten or more years of experience in IT and consumer electronics.
* Experience applying Software lifecycle knowledge of key design principles, methodologies, tools, and high-level architectures.
* Experience with all aspects of the software development lifecycle and one or more project management methodologies (for example, Agile, Waterfall). Knowledge of IT system concepts and how they impact business processes.
* Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills, including the proven ability to adapt to a dynamic project environment and simultaneously manage multiple projects with potentially conflicting priorities and business interests.
* Excellent communication, strong interpersonal and relationship management skills with excellent conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Able to communicate at all levels of management.

**What is Nice to Have**

* Project Management Institute (PMI), Project Management or Professional (PMP) certification, Agile Practitioner or Leader Certification.
* Strong business acumen, and industry / domain-specific knowledge of the enterprise and its business units. Preferred to have finance and SAP-related project experience.
* Program management skills and experience. Well-versed in Change Management and Release Management Processes.
* Experience in working to introduce agile/SCRUM into organizations.

**What Makes You Eligible**

* Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel.
* Be willing to work in an office in Richardson, TX, or Novi, MI (hybrid).
* Successfully able to complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment.

**What We Offer**

* Competitive wellness benefits and 401K Retirement Savings plan.
* An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages career development opportunities.
* Flexible work schedule with a culture encouraging work-life integration and collaboration in a global environment.
* Professional development opportunities through HARMAN University’s business and leadership academies and extensive course catalog.
* Tuition Reimbursement.
* Access to employee discounts on world-class HARMAN products (JBL, Harman/Kardon, etc.).
* “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program.
* Professional development opportunities through HARMAN University’s business and leadership academies and extensive course catalog.
* Tuition Reimbursement.
* Access to employee discounts on world-class HARMAN products (JBL, Harman/Kardon, etc.).
* “Be Brilliant” employee recognition and rewards program.


#LI-EC1

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: IT Systems Analyst/Project Manager
description:
Overview:

Incyte is a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery, development, and commercialization of novel medicines to meet serious unmet medical needs in oncology and inflammation and autoimmunity. Incyte is committed to the rigorous pursuit of research and development excellence to improve the lives of patients, make a difference in health care, and build sustainable value.


The Company strives to discover and develop first-in-class and best-in-class medicines-advancing a diverse portfolio of large and small molecules.


Job Summary (Primary function)


IT Systems Analyst/Project Manager will be responsible to steer technology projects, oversee vendor partnerships, and provide specialized operational support for our key technological platforms used in our Biostatistics function. This role will partner with other internal IT teams, external vendors and the key business users to understand business needs, translate those needs into actionable system implementation initiatives and finally implement them following good project management and system development lifecycle (SDLC) methodology.


Essential Functions of the Job (Key responsibilities)

* Provide comprehensive operational support for the existing SAS Grid Platform, ensuring optimal functionality and efficiency.
* Manage the implementation process for SAS LSAF and RStudio Products, from project planning to execution and support.
* Act as the primary point of contact with technology vendors, overseeing the management of these platforms and ensuring service levels are met.
* Collaborate with internal and external support staff to maintain agreed-upon service levels, facilitating effective partnerships for operational excellence.
* Work closely with the Biostatistics team to align technology solutions with departmental needs and objectives.
* Oversee project timelines, budgeting, and resource allocation, ensuring projects meet their goals within the defined scope.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation, keeping stakeholders informed throughout the project lifecycle.


Qualifications (Minimal acceptable level of education, work experience, and competency)

* 7-10 years of experience in the pharmaceuticals industry with hands-on IT systems implementation, support and maintenance skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science or related field.
* Experience in project management in the Biotech or Pharmaceutical industry.
* Must be familiar with Biostats relevant software landscape - previous experience with SAS analytical platforms, RStudio, and R platforms is required.
* Experience with service delivery management using tools like ServiceNow.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms, specifically AWS and/or Azure, and their related infrastructure, environments, and services.
* Strong organizational, communication, and collaborative skills.
* Ability to multitask and adapt in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Technical Skills:

* Knowledge of cloud computing and infrastructure management, with a focus on AWS and Azure platforms.
* Proficiency in implementing, managing, and supporting SAS-based analytics platforms.
* Familiarity with statistical tools such as East, R, and RStudio, which is considered a valuable asset.
* Experience with ServiceNow for incident, request, and change management within technical environments.
* Capability to manage the technical aspects of biostatistics and analytics projects, including service delivery and vendor interactions.
* Proficiency in coordinating IT projects, ensuring adherence to timelines and achieving successful outcomes.
* Strong problem-solving skills, complemented by experience in analytical planning and strategy.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, particularly in cross-cultural collaborative settings.

  

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications. Management reserves the right to change or modify such duties as required.


Incyte Corporation is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We Respect Your Privacy


Learn more at: http://www.incyte.com/privacy-policy


The Incyte hiring organization processes your personal data to manage your job application in order to enter into an employment relationship with you if you are the successful candidate.  

  

During the process, you may be asked to respond to questions that will screen out your application if you do not meet certain objective criteria required by the job. You can learn more about this process here.


You may have the right to access, delete, restrict, edit, move, or object to the use of your personal data. You may also have a right to report concerns to the authority responsible for data privacy in the country where the position is based or where you live or work.


You can learn more about Incyte’s data protection practices here. By accessing this link you can learn about the types of personal data we collect, how we use it, whether collection and processing is optional, sources of the personal data we process, how it is shared, where it is stored or transferred to, how long we keep it, and contact information for Incyte, Incyte’s data protection officer, and your supervisory authority (if applicable).


Please contact privacy@incyte.com if you have any questions or concerns or would like to exercise your rights.

title: Media Manager
description:
1. Overall experience should be 12 to 14 years
  

2. Strong work experience with Media customers
  

3. Perform Stakeholder Analysis
  

4. Prepare set RSA - Requirement study agenda
  

5. Set up RSQ - Requirement study questionnaire
  

6. Circulate RSQ among stakeholders and record the response
  

7. Conduct requirement elicitation
  

8. Capture Functional Requirements or Non-Functional Requirements
  

9. Analyze the requirement - By applying various technique
  

10. Solve the real business problem by analysing the requirement - Fill those gaps
  

11. Understand - Basic researchabout customer and the business background
  

12. Organize and manage the requirement gathered - Prioritize
  

13. Design the solution - Application overview
  

14. Document the designed solution - BRD, FRD, PDD,SRD, FSD, FRS, etc.,
  

15. Circulate the document for peer review or internal stakeholder - QA, Dev, PM
  

16. Provide walkthrough the internal and external stakeholder
  

17. Prepare RTM - Requirement Traceability Matrix to ensure all requirements has been captured and circulate the document to different implementation teams for tracing the requirement in each stage
  

18. Gain signoff from the customer on document prepared - BRD, FRD, PDD, SRD, FSD, FRS, etc.,
  

19. Baseline and store the document for future reference
  

20. Perform UAT testing - this depends on project type , but the BA should perform one level testing to ensure committed is being delivered
  

21. Record lessons learned and circulate within team members

title: Project Lead
description:
»


**Date:** 6 Mar 2024


**Location:** Jaipur, RJ, IN, 302028


**Company:** Hero Motocorp


**Function**

Research & Development - Jaipur
**Pay Band**

M3 to M5
**Role**
* Responsible for Project planning, monitoring and controlling of all product and process development relating issues of projects (including product planning, R&D, Production, Supplier Sourcing, Quality, and sales & marketing) from initial phase up to SOP – either internal or external projects.
* Should be well versed with automobile product development cycle.
* Responsible for system adherence and project stage gate review management and approval process.
**A purpose driven role for you**

Purpose of role is to introduce New product, Upgrade & Refresh for respective customer segment/product platform in achieving customer delight and project QCT targets. Focus on new initiatives for achieving Speed to market, First time right quality and EBITDA at every gate Represent R&D Function at organisation level CFT and Lead the overall project across the organisation.
**A Day in the life**

As a 'Project Lead ' you will drive different PREMIUM projects, working cross-functionally with COC leads, designers, development team, GPP, marketing, legal and external partners across organizations to guarantee a smooth and efficient product delivery. - Monitors and tracks complex programs effectively by providing periodic updates to technical, non-technical teams and senior management. Accountable to introduce New product, Upgrade & Refresh in respective customer segment achieving customer delight
**Academic Qualification & Experience**

Bachelor in Engineering (Mechanical/ Electrical/Electronics)/ Post graduate in Engineering / Management degree
10 -15 years of experience in Vehicle integration/ System architecture/ New Product Development and Project Management , Chassiss Design
**Technical Skills/Knowledge**
* Key exposure to Vehicle integration, Layout and packaging, Chassis or body design development, Component, Product level testing Knowledge of either Body Design, Chassis Development or Vehicle Integration
* Understanding of Manufacturing process- facilities, layout, Supplier, tool maker’s integration in tool/die design and development
* Experience in Project Management
**Behavioural Skills**
* People interpersonal skills
* Emotional intelligence for Leading team
* Business Acumen-Cost estimation, Investment and financial viability business case workout,
* Project management
* Conflict Resolution
* Negotiation skills
* Stake Holder Management
**What will it be like to work for Hero**

As the **world’s largest** manufacturer of motorcycles and scooters for the last **22 years**, Hero is where you will get to work with the brightest innovators, passionate about being the best in what they do. You will become a part of India’s proudest legacy, a brand that is celebrated by **110 million Indians** and is now taking over the world with its manufacturing superpower. If you are someone who dreams big and goes after their dreams with absolute conviction, Hero is your place to be. At Hero, we are building a cutting-edge future of mobility, pushing frontiers of innovation and aiming for the very best. **Choose to be with the best, choose to be your best.**
**About Hero**

Headquartered in New Delhi (India), Hero MotoCorp is the **world's largest** manufacturer of motorcycles and scooters for 22 consecutive years. We are at the forefront of developing modern, technologically superior and eco-friendly mobility solutions for its millions of customers around the world.
Hero MotoCorp has rapidly transformed into a true multinational organization with a presence in **47 countries** across Asia, Africa, Latin America and the Middle East.
We have achieved the coveted milestone of **110 million cumulative production** and sales since inception. Aligned with its Vision **“Be the Future of Mobility”**, Hero MotoCorp plans to achieve its next **100 million sales by 2030.**
We have a globally benchmarked manufacturing and Research & Development (R&D) ecosystem that is spread across global geographies. Its R&D facilities are located in India and Germany - the Centre of Innovation and Technology (CIT) at Jaipur, India, and the Tech Centre Germany (TCG), near Munich. Hero MotoCorp’s eight ‘green’ manufacturing facilities are spread across India (6), Colombia (1) and Bangladesh (1).
Hero MotoCorp is the pre-eminent leader in the Indian two-wheeler market. It is the only motorcycle manufacturing company listed in Dow Jones Sustainability Index.
In 2022, Hero MotoCorp launched a separate brand for emerging mobility solutions, including Electric Vehicles (EV) - **VIDA**, Powered by Hero. VIDA has commenced sales of VIDA V1 – its first EV – in India and plans to launch the product in global markets.
We are one of the largest global corporate promoters of multiple sporting disciplines. Hero is globally associated with golf, football, field hockey, cricket and motorsports. Hero MotoSports Team Rally is one of India’s flag-bearers in global rally racing. The iconic golfer Tiger Woods is Hero MotoCorp’s Global Corporate Partner.
Read more about us.
Be with the best. Be your best. Catch-up on all our latest openings.
Recruitment assessments – We at Hero are equal opportunity employer and committed to a policy of treating all its employees and job applications equally. Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
Job description
Some careers shine brighter than others.


If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.


HSBC is one of the largest banking and financial services organisations in the world, with operations in 64 countries and territories. We aim to be where the growth is, enabling businesses to thrive and economies to prosper, and, ultimately, helping people to fulfil their hopes and realise their ambitions.


We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Project Manager


In this role, you will:


* Design, develop, and implement automation solutions for infrastructure provisioning, Configuration management and deployment processes.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities and prioritize initiatives based on business needs.
* Lead the evaluation, selection, and integration of automation tools and technologies.
* Establish best practices and standards for infrastructure automation, ensuring consistency and scalability across the organization.
* Develop and maintain documentation for automation workflows, procedures, and configurations.
* Monitor and optimize automated processes to improve performance, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members on automation techniques and best practices.
* Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in infrastructure automation·
Requirements
To be successful in this role, you should meet the following requirements:


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience)
* 15+ years of experience in infrastructure management, DevOps, or related roles
* Solid experience in infrastructure technologies, UNIX/LINUX, Database, Middleware products e.g., MQ, WAS, HIS…etc.
* Proven track record of designing and implementing automation solutions in production environment.
* Deep understanding of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles and tools such as Terraform, Ansible or Puppet.
* Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bas, PowerShell) for automation and orchestration tasks.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS) and cloud automation tools.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, or similar.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Relevant certifications - HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate, Certified Professional in Python Programming and Red Hat Certified Specialist in Ansible Automation…etc

You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.


www.hsbc.com/careers


HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.


Issued by – HSBC Software Development India

title: Project Manager
description: **JD :** Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Technical Support Team • Act as a senior agent who will drive customer satisfaction through customer support • Act as a mentor and provide oversight, coaching, and training to technical support staff • Be the point of contact when it comes to technical escalations • Record and track team SLAs and workflows • Provide support where needed for both internal and external customers. • Clearly communicate escalated issues to Tier 3 and product managers as needed • Manage and report on all incoming technical support inquiries • On-board all new technical support team members • Assist in the creation of the team KPIs as well as monitor and report on results • Be actively involved with the operational delivery and UAT if required for new product and feature releases • Monitor team performance and report on metrics • Ensure that all customer inquiries and issues are solved correctly and in a prompt and professional manner • Work to create any relevant support material for the team • Provide a feedback loop to wider staff and customers on resolved and in progress problems and incidents • Implement any necessary preventive measures to reduce customer faults and issues • Review all technical support related processes and documentation for continuous improvement • Assist in the creation and implementation of customer self-service material and tools • Strong analytical skills to investigate and resolve customer support tickets • Able to multi-task efficiently under time pressure • Able to work with cutting edge technology and assimilate information rapidly • Previous experience in managing customer focused teams • Proven experience in managing a service and support focused team culture • Associates or Bachelor degree in Information Technology or a related field preferred • Five Years plus experience in a Technical Support role

title: Associate Project Manager
description:
**Job Title**


Associate Project Manager
Job Description
Job Description
About PSM:


This (PSM) function aims to create the liaison between technology platform (horizontal) services, platform and middleware delivery teams and the rest of the Amadeus organization. This organization is accountable of Key services to influence the platform organization, such demand management, portfolio management, service delivery management, commercial ownership, moving to cloud, this function is taking part to orchestrate the onboarding of workload on the platform: from the "Cost view", to the "technical analysis" in coordination with platform delivery teams, close follow-up of the onboarding and the transition to "Business As Usual" (FinOps, SLA, ...). to build an effective, customer focused onboarding services in coordination with the other GTC/Amadeus teams/customers.


High level CMCC Mission Scope:

* Migrate applications workload/traffic of all our customers (Execute and follow-up progress). The person is expected to drive key process areas as part of Project Management responsibilities like Migration Process, Execution, Support, Customer Facing Test, Cutover Preparation, Cutover, Post Cutover etc.. The person will be highly exposed to various internal/BU stakeholders including Amadeus senior leaders and would need good communication/influence/leadership skills.
* Industrialize and optimize the Applications Migration to stick to the end date of the program and secure the production stability
* Lower the risk to allow cutovers at scale


Common accountabilities:  

* Part of the Cloud Migration Control Center Team (CMCC) that industrializes, optimizes and secures overall applications cloud migrations
* Processes enhancements (change management, Go/NoGo, business continuity,..):
* to work on some tasks already described in CMCC Kanban Boards.
* to improve processes based on cutover experiences.
* strong interaction/coordination with various Amadeus and Microsoft Teams
* Migration Execution
* Liaise with application teams to organise/participate/monitor cutovers
* Provide status and KPIs on progress of the migration
* Around 500 applications have to be migrated to the Cloud
* Has working experience and advanced and specialized technical/functional knowledge in own discipline. Understands how own area contributes to the business. Acts as a reference for colleagues with less experience and supports junior team members.
* Influences decisions related to own activity, anticipating dependencies and consequences in complex scenarios, contributes to transversal projects, proposes improvements to processes and is accountable for own and team commitments.
* Works independently within plan dictated by manager, with some guidance on most complex situations.


Specific accountabilities:


Cloud Knowledge in particular on Platform  

Good project management experience  

Very good soft and hard communication skills  

Resilient, Autonomous and Rigorous is a must have  

Ability to work with the team in place (in both ERD, Nice and Bangalore) and under high level of exposure/ pressure  

Pro active  

Create and execute work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements  

Manage the day-to-day operational aspects of the projects  

Ensure management of projects controls (risks, issues and dependencies)  

Effectively apply the Amadeus project management methodology and enforces project standards  

Ensure that the project is managed to budget, time and quality and that it delivers the benefits anticipated in the business case. Responsible for problem resolution and project success.  

This job profile participate in the preparation of the following key deliverables:  

* Meeting management: Steering committee, Project Status meetings
* Documentation: Project Management Plan including, schedule, cost, scope...
* Engagement reviews and quality assurance procedures.


Communication with stakeholders both internal and external  

Project accounting: progress reports, budget management and invoicing**Diversity & Inclusion**


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

Designs, develops and manages activities for a specific product or group of products from product definition and planning through production, release, and end of life. Serves as the central resource with design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing as the product(s) move to production and distribution. Involvement lasts throughout all stages of a product's lifecycle including modifications, upgrades and maintenance of the product or product line. Works closely with product development to create products and validates product definitions with external customers and sales. Uses technical expertise and extensive industry experience to formulate product strategies and identify new product opportunities. Responsible for developing project plans designed to address customer needs and/or expand market share.  

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field. 4+ years of technical product management experience with at least 2+ years of end-to-end product delivery experience with cross functional teams. Advanced English level. Preferred Qualifications: Software Development background preferred. Familiarity with JIRA tool.  

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

Intel's Information Technology Group (IT) designs, deploys and supports the information technology architecture and hardware/software applications for Intel. This includes the LAN, WAN, telephony, data centers, client PCs, backup and restore, and enterprise applications. IT is also responsible for e-Commerce development, data hosting and delivery of Web content and services.  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

  

It has come to our notice that some people have received fake job interview letters ostensibly issued by Intel, inviting them to attend interviews in Intel’s offices for various positions and further requiring them to deposit money to be eligible for the interviews. We wish to bring to your notice that these letters are not issued by Intel or any of its authorized representatives. Hiring at Intel is based purely on merit and Intel does not ask or require candidates to deposit any money. We would urge people interested in working for Intel, to apply directly at https://jobs.intel.com/ and not fall prey to unscrupulous elements.  

**Working Model**
-----------------

  

This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. **In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.**  

JobType


Hybrid

title: Clinic Manager
description:
393645BR
**SSO Clinical Project Manager**
================================


India
**About the role**


That’s how many patients participate in our clinical trials at any given time. GCO is Novartis’ powerhouse of Global Clinical Operations, redesigned to enable faster trial recruitment and enhanced trial delivery resulting in more timely access for patients to potential novel treatments. Every day, we are the link between science and medicine – imagine the impact you could have.  

  

Job Purpose:  

  

The SSO Clinical Project Manager (CPM) is accountable for the day-to-day planning, executing and reporting, (from first site initiation visit to and including study site close-out), of assigned Global Drug Development (GDD) studies in compliance with Novartis processes and regulatory requirements. The CPM is the single point of contact and study team lead, within the country/cluster/hub, for the assigned studies. The CPM is responsible for assuring aligned communication with Trial Lead and other CTT members, locally with Clinical Research Associates (CRAs), CRA Managers and other key associates on the execution and progress of their studies. The CPM collaborates with the SSO Country Manager, SSO Country Head, SSO Feasibility Manager, SSO Study Start-up Manager and SSO Site Partnership Manager in the planning, execution, and delivery of their assigned studies. Accountable for execution and reporting of assigned GDD studies in E2E product line Clinical Operations Program Head/Study Lead/ CPM – CRA. Can be assigned partially to participate in the review process of Site Monitoring Plans across Portfolio.  

  

Key Responsibilities:  

* When requested by the SSO Feasibility Manager supports the study feasibility by providing input to the study protocol, and operational aspects of the study, Maintains a strong knowledge of the study protocol to answer standard operational questions from CRAs, sites and Country/Cluster/Hub personnel

  

* Drives the conduct of the study, (tracks status, maintains relevant reporting systems, oversees forecasts, progress, and mitigation plans), to ensure all study operational aspects are on track. Ensures recruitment targets are met and reviews enrolment at the site level including responsibility for getting approval from the Study Leader on enrolling above site targets. Responsible to set up contingency plan to ensure recruitment targets are achieved in accordance with trial execution plan

  

* Oversees local study team activities to achieve study timelines and quality execution, (proposing and implementing corrective actions where appropriate), according to Novartis standards and relevant regulations, Leads/chairs country/cluster/hub study team meetings, participates in global clinical trial team meetings, as required and is the single point of contact for the conduct of assigned studies

  

* Maintains oversight of country/cluster/hub level data management activities, including timely understanding of screen failure reasons and discontinuation rates, review of patient profiles, and proactively identifies data entry issues (on quality and timing) to mitigate queries, proactively identifies query resolution issues, Coordinates the study handover process with CRAs and their managers to ensure proper documentation and communication, when necessary

  

* Tracks that all study close–out activities are performed in a timely manner, in collaboration with CRAs and key study stakeholders

**Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:**


*We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.*
**Role Requirements**


Minimum Requirements:  

  

* A degree in scientific or health discipline required and advanced degree with clinical trial experience and/or project management, is preferable
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in clinical research in a role that oversees (project management) and/or with monitoring clinical trials
* Capable of leading in a matrix environment, without direct reports and working cross-border managing study in various countries
* Understanding of all aspects of clinical drug development with particular emphasis on monitoring and study execution
* Strong project management capabilities with demonstrated ability to problem solve and mediate complex issues
* Thorough understanding of the international aspects of drug development process, including strong knowledge of international standards (GCP/ICH), health authorities (FDA/EMA), local/National Health Authorities regulations and Novartis standards

  

Why Novartis: Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us! Learn more here: https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture  

  

You’ll receive: You can find everything you need to know about our benefits and rewards in the Novartis Life Handbook.  

https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards  

  

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network.
